 91 
 92  /**
 93   * @version  OpenSeadragon 0.9.131
 94   *
 95   * @fileOverview
 96   * <h2>
 97   * <strong>
 98   * OpenSeadragon - Javascript Deep Zooming
 99   * </strong>
100   * </h2>
101   * <p>
102   * OpenSeadragon is provides an html interface for creating
103   * deep zoom user interfaces.  The simplest examples include deep
104   * zoom for large resolution images, and complex examples include
105   * zoomable map interfaces driven by SVG files.
106   * </p>
107   */
108 
109  /**
110   * The root namespace for OpenSeadragon, this function also serves as a single
111   * point of instantiation for an {@link OpenSeadragon.Viewer}, including all
112   * combinations of out-of-the-box configurable features.  All utility methods
113   * and classes are defined on or below this namespace.
114   *
115   * @namespace
116   * @function
117   * @name OpenSeadragon
118   * @exports $ as OpenSeadragon
119   *
120   * @param {Object} options All required and optional settings for instantiating
121   *     a new instance of an OpenSeadragon image viewer.
122   *
123   * @param {String} options.xmlPath
124   *     DEPRECATED. A relative path to load a DZI file from the server.
125   *     Prefer the newer options.tileSources.
126   *
127   * @param {Array|String|Function|Object[]|Array[]|String[]|Function[]} options.tileSources
128   *     As an Array, the tileSource can hold either be all Objects or mixed
129   *     types of Arrays of Objects, String, Function. When a value is a String,
130   *     the tileSource is used to create a {@link OpenSeadragon.DziTileSource}.
131   *     When a value is a Function, the function is used to create a new
132   *     {@link OpenSeadragon.TileSource} whose abstract method
133   *     getUrl( level, x, y ) is implemented by the function. Finally, when it
134   *     is an Array of objects, it is used to create a
135   *     {@link OpenSeadragon.LegacyTileSource}.
136   *
137   * @param {Boolean} [options.debugMode=true]
138   *     Currently does nothing. TODO: provide an in-screen panel providing event
139   *     detail feedback.
140   *
141   * @param {Number} [options.animationTime=1.5]
142   *     Specifies the animation duration per each {@link OpenSeadragon.Spring}
143   *     which occur when the image is dragged or zoomed.
144   *
145   * @param {Number} [options.blendTime=0.5]
146   *     Specifies the duration of animation as higher or lower level tiles are
147   *     replacing the existing tile.
148   *
149   * @param {Boolean} [options.alwaysBlend=false]
150   *     Forces the tile to always blend.  By default the tiles skip blending
151   *     when the blendTime is surpassed and the current animation frame would
152   *     not complete the blend.
153   *
154   * @param {Boolean} [options.autoHideControls=true]
155   *     If the user stops interacting with the viewport, fade the navigation
156   *     controls.  Useful for presentation since the controls are by default
157   *     floated on top of the image the user is viewing.
158   *
159   * @param {Boolean} [options.immediateRender=false]
160   *     Render the best closest level first, ignoring the lowering levels which
161   *     provide the effect of very blurry to sharp. It is recommended to change
162   *     setting to true for mobile devices.
163   *
164   * @param {Boolean} [options.wrapHorizontal=false]
165   *     Set to true to force the image to wrap horizontally within the viewport.
166   *     Useful for maps or images representing the surface of a sphere or cylinder.
167   *
168   * @param {Boolean} [options.wrapVertical=false]
169   *     Set to true to force the image to wrap vertically within the viewport.
170   *     Useful for maps or images representing the surface of a sphere or cylinder.
171   *
172   * @param {Number} [options.minZoomImageRatio=0.8]
173   *     The minimum percentage ( expressed as a number between 0 and 1 ) of
174   *     the viewport height or width at which the zoom out will be constrained.
175   *     Setting it to 0, for example will allow you to zoom out infinitly.
176   *
177   * @param {Number} [options.maxZoomPixelRatio=2]
178   *     The maximum ratio to allow a zoom-in to affect the highest level pixel
179   *     ratio. This can be set to Infinity to allow 'infinite' zooming into the
180   *     image though it is less effective visually if the HTML5 Canvas is not
181   *     availble on the viewing device.
182   *
183   * @param {Number} [options.visibilityRatio=0.5]
184   *     The percentage ( as a number from 0 to 1 ) of the source image which
185   *     must be kept within the viewport.  If the image is dragged beyond that
186   *     limit, it will 'bounce' back until the minimum visibility ration is
187   *     achieved.  Setting this to 0 and wrapHorizontal ( or wrapVertical ) to
188   *     true will provide the effect of an infinitely scrolling viewport.
189   *
190   * @param {Number} [options.springStiffness=5.0]
191   *
192   * @param {Number} [options.imageLoaderLimit=0]
193   *     The maximum number of image requests to make concurrently.  By default
194   *     it is set to 0 allowing the browser to make the maximum number of
195   *     image requests in parallel as allowed by the browsers policy.
196   *
197   * @param {Number} [options.clickTimeThreshold=200]
198   *     If multiple mouse clicks occurs within less than this number of
199   *     milliseconds, treat them as a single click.
200   *
201   * @param {Number} [options.clickDistThreshold=5]
202   *     If a mouse or touch drag occurs and the distance to the starting drag
203   *     point is less than this many pixels, ignore the drag event.
204   *
205   * @param {Number} [options.zoomPerClick=2.0]
206   *     The "zoom distance" per mouse click or touch tap.
207   *
208   * @param {Number} [options.zoomPerScroll=1.2]
209   *     The "zoom distance" per mouse scroll or touch pinch.
210   *
211   * @param {Number} [options.zoomPerSecond=2.0]
212   *     The number of seconds to animate a single zoom event over.
213   *
214   * @param {Boolean} [options.showNavigationControl=true]
215   *     Set to false to prevent the appearance of the default navigation controls.
216   *
217   * @param {Boolean} [options.showNavigator=false]
218   *     Set to true to make the navigator minimap appear.
219   *
220   * @param {Boolean} [options.navigatorId=navigator-GENERATED DATE]
221   *     Set the ID of a div to hold the navigator minimap.  If one is not specified,
222   *     one will be generated and placed on top of the main image
223   *
224   * @param {Number} [options.controlsFadeDelay=2000]
225   *     The number of milliseconds to wait once the user has stopped interacting
226   *     with the interface before begining to fade the controls. Assumes
227   *     showNavigationControl and autoHideControls are both true.
228   *
229   * @param {Number} [options.controlsFadeLength=1500]
230   *     The number of milliseconds to animate the controls fading out.
231   *
232   * @param {Number} [options.maxImageCacheCount=100]
233   *     The max number of images we should keep in memory (per drawer).
234   *
235   * @param {Number} [options.minPixelRatio=0.5]
236   *     The higher the minPixelRatio, the lower the quality of the image that
237   *     is considered sufficient to stop rendering a given zoom level.  For
238   *     example, if you are targeting mobile devices with less bandwith you may
239   *     try setting this to 1.5 or higher.
240   *
241   * @param {Boolean} [options.mouseNavEnabled=true]
242   *     Is the user able to interact with the image via mouse or touch. Default
243   *     interactions include draging the image in a plane, and zooming in toward
244   *     and away from the image.
245   *
246   * @param {Boolean} [options.preserveViewport=false]
247   *     If the viewer has been configured with a sequence of tile sources, then
248   *     normally navigating to through each image resets the viewport to 'home'
249   *     position.  If preserveViewport is set to true, then the viewport position
250   *     is preserved when navigating between images in the sequence.
251   *
252   * @param {String} [options.prefixUrl='/images/']
253   *     Prepends the prefixUrl to navImages paths, which is very useful
254   *     since the default paths are rarely useful for production
255   *     environments.
256   *
257   * @param {Object} [options.navImages=]
258   *     An object with a property for each button or other built-in navigation
259   *     control, eg the current 'zoomIn', 'zoomOut', 'home', and 'fullpage'.
260   *     Each of those in turn provides an image path for each state of the botton
261   *     or navigation control, eg 'REST', 'GROUP', 'HOVER', 'PRESS'. Finally the
262   *     image paths, by default assume there is a folder on the servers root path
263   *     called '/images', eg '/images/zoomin_rest.png'.  If you need to adjust
264   *     these paths, prefer setting the option.prefixUrl rather than overriding
265   *     every image path directly through this setting.
266   *
267   * @param {Boolean} [options.navPrevNextWrap=false]
268   *     If the 'previous' button will wrap to the last image when viewing the first
269   *     image and if the 'next' button will wrap to the first image when viewing
270   *     the last image.
271   *
272   * @returns {OpenSeadragon.Viewer}
273   */
274 window.OpenSeadragon = window.OpenSeadragon || function( options ){
275 
276     return new OpenSeadragon.Viewer( options );
277 
278 };
279 
280 (function( $ ){
281 
282 
283     /**
284      * Taken from jquery 1.6.1
285      * [[Class]] -> type pairs
286      * @private
287      */
288     var class2type = {
289         '[object Boolean]':     'boolean',
290         '[object Number]':      'number',
291         '[object String]':      'string',
292         '[object Function]':    'function',
293         '[object Array]':       'array',
294         '[object Date]':        'date',
295         '[object RegExp]':      'regexp',
296         '[object Object]':      'object'
297     },
298     // Save a reference to some core methods
299     toString    = Object.prototype.toString,
300     hasOwn      = Object.prototype.hasOwnProperty;
301 
302 
303     /**
304      * Taken from jQuery 1.6.1
305      * @name $.isFunction
306      * @function
307      * @see <a href='http://www.jquery.com/'>jQuery</a>
308      */
309     $.isFunction = function( obj ) {
310         return $.type(obj) === "function";
311     };
312 
313 
314     /**
315      * Taken from jQuery 1.6.1
316      * @name $.isArray
317      * @function
318      * @see <a href='http://www.jquery.com/'>jQuery</a>
319      */
320     $.isArray = Array.isArray || function( obj ) {
321         return $.type(obj) === "array";
322     };
323 
324 
325     /**
326      * A crude way of determining if an object is a window.
327      * Taken from jQuery 1.6.1
328      * @name $.isWindow
329      * @function
330      * @see <a href='http://www.jquery.com/'>jQuery</a>
331      */
332     $.isWindow = function( obj ) {
333         return obj && typeof obj === "object" && "setInterval" in obj;
334     };
335 
336 
337     /**
338      * Taken from jQuery 1.6.1
339      * @name $.type
340      * @function
341      * @see <a href='http://www.jquery.com/'>jQuery</a>
342      */
343     $.type = function( obj ) {
344         return ( obj === null ) || ( obj === undefined ) ?
345             String( obj ) :
346             class2type[ toString.call(obj) ] || "object";
347     };
348 
349 
350     /**
351      * Taken from jQuery 1.6.1
352      * @name $.isPlainObject
353      * @function
354      * @see <a href='http://www.jquery.com/'>jQuery</a>
355      */
356     $.isPlainObject = function( obj ) {
357         // Must be an Object.
358         // Because of IE, we also have to check the presence of the constructor property.
359         // Make sure that DOM nodes and window objects don't pass through, as well
360         if ( !obj || OpenSeadragon.type(obj) !== "object" || obj.nodeType || $.isWindow( obj ) ) {
361             return false;
362         }
363 
364         // Not own constructor property must be Object
365         if ( obj.constructor &&
366             !hasOwn.call(obj, "constructor") &&
367             !hasOwn.call(obj.constructor.prototype, "isPrototypeOf") ) {
368             return false;
369         }
370 
371         // Own properties are enumerated firstly, so to speed up,
372         // if last one is own, then all properties are own.
373 
374         var key;
375         for ( key in obj ) {}
376 
377         return key === undefined || hasOwn.call( obj, key );
378     };
379 
380 
381     /**
382      * Taken from jQuery 1.6.1
383      * @name $.isEmptyObject
384      * @function
385      * @see <a href='http://www.jquery.com/'>jQuery</a>
386      */
387     $.isEmptyObject = function( obj ) {
388         for ( var name in obj ) {
389             return false;
390         }
391         return true;
392     };
393 
394 
395 }( OpenSeadragon ));
396 
397 /**
398  *  This closure defines all static methods available to the OpenSeadragon
399  *  namespace.  Many, if not most, are taked directly from jQuery for use
400  *  to simplify and reduce common programming patterns.  More static methods
401  *  from jQuery may eventually make their way into this though we are
402  *  attempting to avoid an explicit dependency on jQuery only because
403  *  OpenSeadragon is a broadly useful code base and would be made less broad
404  *  by requiring jQuery fully.
405  *
406  *  Some static methods have also been refactored from the original OpenSeadragon
407  *  project.
408  */
409 (function( $ ){
410 
411     /**
412      * Taken from jQuery 1.6.1
413      * @see <a href='http://www.jquery.com/'>jQuery</a>
414      */
415     $.extend = function() {
416         var options,
417             name,
418             src,
419             copy,
420             copyIsArray,
421             clone,
422             target  = arguments[ 0 ] || {},
423             length  = arguments.length,
424             deep    = false,
425             i       = 1;
426 
427         // Handle a deep copy situation
428         if ( typeof target === "boolean" ) {
429             deep    = target;
430             target  = arguments[ 1 ] || {};
431             // skip the boolean and the target
432             i = 2;
433         }
434 
435         // Handle case when target is a string or something (possible in deep copy)
436         if ( typeof target !== "object" && !OpenSeadragon.isFunction( target ) ) {
437             target = {};
438         }
439 
440         // extend jQuery itself if only one argument is passed
441         if ( length === i ) {
442             target = this;
443             --i;
444         }
445 
446         for ( ; i < length; i++ ) {
447             // Only deal with non-null/undefined values
448             options = arguments[ i ];
449             if ( options !== null || options !== undefined ) {
450                 // Extend the base object
451                 for ( name in options ) {
452                     src = target[ name ];
453                     copy = options[ name ];
454 
455                     // Prevent never-ending loop
456                     if ( target === copy ) {
457                         continue;
458                     }
459 
460                     // Recurse if we're merging plain objects or arrays
461                     if ( deep && copy && ( OpenSeadragon.isPlainObject( copy ) || ( copyIsArray = OpenSeadragon.isArray( copy ) ) ) ) {
462                         if ( copyIsArray ) {
463                             copyIsArray = false;
464                             clone = src && OpenSeadragon.isArray( src ) ? src : [];
465 
466                         } else {
467                             clone = src && OpenSeadragon.isPlainObject( src ) ? src : {};
468                         }
469 
470                         // Never move original objects, clone them
471                         target[ name ] = OpenSeadragon.extend( deep, clone, copy );
472 
473                     // Don't bring in undefined values
474                     } else if ( copy !== undefined ) {
475                         target[ name ] = copy;
476                     }
477                 }
478             }
479         }
480 
481         // Return the modified object
482         return target;
483     };
484 
485 
486     $.extend( $, {
487         /**
488          * These are the default values for the optional settings documented
489          * in the {@link OpenSeadragon} constructor detail.
490          * @name $.DEFAULT_SETTINGS
491          * @static
492          */
493         DEFAULT_SETTINGS: {
494             //DATA SOURCE DETAILS
495             xmlPath:                null,
496             tileSources:            null,
497             tileHost:               null,
498 
499             //PAN AND ZOOM SETTINGS AND CONSTRAINTS
500             panHorizontal:          true,
501             panVertical:            true,
502             constrainDuringPan:     false,
503             wrapHorizontal:         false,
504             wrapVertical:           false,
505             visibilityRatio:        0.5, //-> how much of the viewer can be negative space
506             minPixelRatio:          0.5, //->closer to 0 draws tiles meant for a higher zoom at this zoom
507             defaultZoomLevel:       0,
508             minZoomLevel:           null,
509             maxZoomLevel:           null,
510 
511             //UI RESPONSIVENESS AND FEEL
512             springStiffness:        7.0,
513             clickTimeThreshold:     300,
514             clickDistThreshold:     5,
515             zoomPerClick:           2,
516             zoomPerScroll:          1.2,
517             zoomPerSecond:          1.0,
518             animationTime:          1.2,
519             blendTime:              0,
520             alwaysBlend:            false,
521             autoHideControls:       true,
522             immediateRender:        false,
523             minZoomImageRatio:      0.9, //-> closer to 0 allows zoom out to infinity
524             maxZoomPixelRatio:      1.1, //-> higher allows 'over zoom' into pixels
525 
526             //DEFAULT CONTROL SETTINGS
527             showSequenceControl:    true,  //SEQUENCE
528             preserveViewport:       false, //SEQUENCE
529             showNavigationControl:  true,  //ZOOM/HOME/FULL/SEQUENCE
530             controlsFadeDelay:      2000,  //ZOOM/HOME/FULL/SEQUENCE
531             controlsFadeLength:     1500,  //ZOOM/HOME/FULL/SEQUENCE
532             mouseNavEnabled:        true,  //GENERAL MOUSE INTERACTIVITY
533 
534             //VIEWPORT NAVIGATOR SETTINGS
535             showNavigator:          false,
536             navigatorId:            null,
537             navigatorHeight:        null,
538             navigatorWidth:         null,
539             navigatorPosition:      null,
540             navigatorSizeRatio:     0.2,
541 
542             // INITIAL ROTATION
543             degrees:                0,
544 
545             //REFERENCE STRIP SETTINGS
546             showReferenceStrip:          false,
547             referenceStripScroll:       'horizontal',
548             referenceStripElement:       null,
549             referenceStripHeight:        null,
550             referenceStripWidth:         null,
551             referenceStripPosition:      'BOTTOM_LEFT',
552             referenceStripSizeRatio:     0.2,
553 
554             //COLLECTION VISUALIZATION SETTINGS
555             collectionRows:         3, //or columns depending on layout
556             collectionLayout:       'horizontal', //vertical
557             collectionMode:         false,
558             collectionTileSize:     800,
559 
560             //EVENT RELATED CALLBACKS
561             onPageChange:           null,
562 
563             //PERFORMANCE SETTINGS
564             imageLoaderLimit:       0,
565             maxImageCacheCount:     200,
566             timeout:                30000,
567 
568             //INTERFACE RESOURCE SETTINGS
569             prefixUrl:              "/images/",
570             navImages: {
571                 zoomIn: {
572                     REST:   'zoomin_rest.png',
573                     GROUP:  'zoomin_grouphover.png',
574                     HOVER:  'zoomin_hover.png',
575                     DOWN:   'zoomin_pressed.png'
576                 },
577                 zoomOut: {
578                     REST:   'zoomout_rest.png',
579                     GROUP:  'zoomout_grouphover.png',
580                     HOVER:  'zoomout_hover.png',
581                     DOWN:   'zoomout_pressed.png'
582                 },
583                 home: {
584                     REST:   'home_rest.png',
585                     GROUP:  'home_grouphover.png',
586                     HOVER:  'home_hover.png',
587                     DOWN:   'home_pressed.png'
588                 },
589                 fullpage: {
590                     REST:   'fullpage_rest.png',
591                     GROUP:  'fullpage_grouphover.png',
592                     HOVER:  'fullpage_hover.png',
593                     DOWN:   'fullpage_pressed.png'
594                 },
595                 previous: {
596                     REST:   'previous_rest.png',
597                     GROUP:  'previous_grouphover.png',
598                     HOVER:  'previous_hover.png',
599                     DOWN:   'previous_pressed.png'
600                 },
601                 next: {
602                     REST:   'next_rest.png',
603                     GROUP:  'next_grouphover.png',
604                     HOVER:  'next_hover.png',
605                     DOWN:   'next_pressed.png'
606                 }
607             },
608             navPrevNextWrap:        false,
609 
610             //DEVELOPER SETTINGS
611             debugMode:              false,
612             debugGridColor:         '#437AB2'
613         },
614 
615 
616         /**
617          * TODO: get rid of this.  I can't see how it's required at all.  Looks
618          *       like an early legacy code artifact.
619          * @static
620          * @ignore
621          */
622         SIGNAL: "----seadragon----",
623 
624 
625         /**
626          * Invokes the the method as if it where a method belonging to the object.
627          * @name $.delegate
628          * @function
629          * @param {Object} object
630          * @param {Function} method
631          */
632         delegate: function( object, method ) {
633             return function(){
634                 var args = arguments;
635                 if ( args === undefined ){
636                     args = [];
637                 }
638                 return method.apply( object, args );
639             };
640         },
641 
642 
643         /**
644          * An enumeration of Browser vendors including UNKNOWN, IE, FIREFOX,
645          * SAFARI, CHROME, and OPERA.
646          * @name $.BROWSERS
647          * @static
648          */
649         BROWSERS: {
650             UNKNOWN:    0,
651             IE:         1,
652             FIREFOX:    2,
653             SAFARI:     3,
654             CHROME:     4,
655             OPERA:      5
656         },
657 
658 
659         /**
660          * Returns a DOM Element for the given id or element.
661          * @function
662          * @name OpenSeadragon.getElement
663          * @param {String|Element} element Accepts an id or element.
664          * @returns {Element} The element with the given id, null, or the element itself.
665          */
666         getElement: function( element ) {
667             if ( typeof ( element ) == "string" ) {
668                 element = document.getElementById( element );
669             }
670             return element;
671         },
672 
673 
674         /**
675          * Determines the position of the upper-left corner of the element.
676          * @function
677          * @name OpenSeadragon.getElementPosition
678          * @param {Element|String} element - the elemenet we want the position for.
679          * @returns {Point} - the position of the upper left corner of the element.
680          */
681         getElementPosition: function( element ) {
682             var result = new $.Point(),
683                 isFixed,
684                 offsetParent;
685 
686             element      = $.getElement( element );
687             isFixed      = $.getElementStyle( element ).position == "fixed";
688             offsetParent = getOffsetParent( element, isFixed );
689 
690             while ( offsetParent ) {
691 
692                 result.x += element.offsetLeft;
693                 result.y += element.offsetTop;
694 
695                 if ( isFixed ) {
696                     result = result.plus( $.getPageScroll() );
697                 }
698 
699                 element = offsetParent;
700                 isFixed = $.getElementStyle( element ).position == "fixed";
701                 offsetParent = getOffsetParent( element, isFixed );
702             }
703 
704             return result;
705         },
706 
707 
708         /**
709          * Determines the height and width of the given element.
710          * @function
711          * @name OpenSeadragon.getElementSize
712          * @param {Element|String} element
713          * @returns {Point}
714          */
715         getElementSize: function( element ) {
716             element = $.getElement( element );
717 
718             return new $.Point(
719                 element.clientWidth,
720                 element.clientHeight
721             );
722         },
723 
724 
725         /**
726          * Returns the CSSStyle object for the given element.
727          * @function
728          * @name OpenSeadragon.getElementStyle
729          * @param {Element|String} element
730          * @returns {CSSStyle}
731          */
732         getElementStyle:
733             document.documentElement.currentStyle ?
734             function( element ) {
735                 element = $.getElement( element );
736                 return element.currentStyle;
737             } :
738             function( element ) {
739                 element = $.getElement( element );
740                 return window.getComputedStyle( element, "" );
741             },
742 
743 
744         /**
745          * Gets the latest event, really only useful internally since its
746          * specific to IE behavior.  TODO: Deprecate this from the api and
747          * use it internally.
748          * @function
749          * @name OpenSeadragon.getEvent
750          * @param {Event} [event]
751          * @returns {Event}
752          */
753         getEvent: function( event ) {
754             if( event ){
755                 $.getEvent = function( event ) {
756                     return event;
757                 };
758             } else {
759                 $.getEvent = function() {
760                     return window.event;
761                 };
762             }
763             return $.getEvent( event );
764         },
765 
766 
767         /**
768          * Gets the position of the mouse on the screen for a given event.
769          * @function
770          * @name OpenSeadragon.getMousePosition
771          * @param {Event} [event]
772          * @returns {Point}
773          */
774         getMousePosition: function( event ) {
775 
776             if ( typeof( event.pageX ) == "number" ) {
777                 $.getMousePosition = function( event ){
778                     var result = new $.Point();
779 
780                     event = $.getEvent( event );
781                     result.x = event.pageX;
782                     result.y = event.pageY;
783 
784                     return result;
785                 };
786             } else if ( typeof( event.clientX ) == "number" ) {
787                 $.getMousePosition = function( event ){
788                     var result = new $.Point();
789 
790                     event = $.getEvent( event );
791                     result.x =
792                         event.clientX +
793                         document.body.scrollLeft +
794                         document.documentElement.scrollLeft;
795                     result.y =
796                         event.clientY +
797                         document.body.scrollTop +
798                         document.documentElement.scrollTop;
799 
800                     return result;
801                 };
802             } else {
803                 throw new Error(
804                     "Unknown event mouse position, no known technique."
805                 );
806             }
807 
808             return $.getMousePosition( event );
809         },
810 
811 
812         /**
813          * Determines the pages current scroll position.
814          * @function
815          * @name OpenSeadragon.getPageScroll
816          * @returns {Point}
817          */
818         getPageScroll: function() {
819             var docElement  = document.documentElement || {},
820                 body        = document.body || {};
821 
822             if ( typeof( window.pageXOffset ) == "number" ) {
823                 $.getPageScroll = function(){
824                     return new $.Point(
825                         window.pageXOffset,
826                         window.pageYOffset
827                     );
828                 };
829             } else if ( body.scrollLeft || body.scrollTop ) {
830                 $.getPageScroll = function(){
831                     return new $.Point(
832                         document.body.scrollLeft,
833                         document.body.scrollTop
834                     );
835                 };
836             } else if ( docElement.scrollLeft || docElement.scrollTop ) {
837                 $.getPageScroll = function(){
838                     return new $.Point(
839                         document.documentElement.scrollLeft,
840                         document.documentElement.scrollTop
841                     );
842                 };
843             } else {
844                 $.getPageScroll = function(){
845                     return new $.Point(0,0);
846                 };
847             }
848 
849             return $.getPageScroll();
850         },
851 
852 
853         /**
854          * Determines the size of the browsers window.
855          * @function
856          * @name OpenSeadragon.getWindowSize
857          * @returns {Point}
858          */
859         getWindowSize: function() {
860             var docElement = document.documentElement || {},
861                 body    = document.body || {};
862 
863             if ( typeof( window.innerWidth ) == 'number' ) {
864                 $.getWindowSize = function(){
865                     return new $.Point(
866                         window.innerWidth,
867                         window.innerHeight
868                     );
869                 };
870             } else if ( docElement.clientWidth || docElement.clientHeight ) {
871                 $.getWindowSize = function(){
872                     return new $.Point(
873                         document.documentElement.clientWidth,
874                         document.documentElement.clientHeight
875                     );
876                 };
877             } else if ( body.clientWidth || body.clientHeight ) {
878                 $.getWindowSize = function(){
879                     return new $.Point(
880                         document.body.clientWidth,
881                         document.body.clientHeight
882                     );
883                 };
884             } else {
885                 throw new Error("Unknown window size, no known technique.");
886             }
887 
888             return $.getWindowSize();
889         },
890 
891 
892         /**
893          * Wraps the given element in a nest of divs so that the element can
894          * be easily centered using CSS tables
895          * @function
896          * @name OpenSeadragon.makeCenteredNode
897          * @param {Element|String} element
898          * @returns {Element} outermost wrapper element
899          */
900         makeCenteredNode: function( element ) {
901             // Convert a possible ID to an actual HTMLElement
902             element = $.getElement( element );
903 
904             /*
905                 CSS tables require you to have a display:table/row/cell hierarchy so we need to create
906                 three nested wrapper divs:
907              */
908 
909             var wrappers = [
910                 $.makeNeutralElement( 'div' ),
911                 $.makeNeutralElement( 'div' ),
912                 $.makeNeutralElement( 'div' )
913             ];
914 
915             // It feels like we should be able to pass style dicts to makeNeutralElement:
916             $.extend(wrappers[0].style, {
917                 display: "table",
918                 height: "100%",
919                 width: "100%"
920             });
921 
922             $.extend(wrappers[1].style, {
923                 display: "table-row"
924             });
925 
926             $.extend(wrappers[2].style, {
927                 display: "table-cell",
928                 verticalAlign: "middle",
929                 textAlign: "center"
930             });
931 
932             wrappers[0].appendChild(wrappers[1]);
933             wrappers[1].appendChild(wrappers[2]);
934             wrappers[2].appendChild(element);
935 
936             return wrappers[0];
937         },
938 
939 
940         /**
941          * Creates an easily positionable element of the given type that therefor
942          * serves as an excellent container element.
943          * @function
944          * @name OpenSeadragon.makeNeutralElement
945          * @param {String} tagName
946          * @returns {Element}
947          */
948         makeNeutralElement: function( tagName ) {
949             var element = document.createElement( tagName ),
950                 style   = element.style;
951 
952             style.background = "transparent none";
953             style.border     = "none";
954             style.margin     = "0px";
955             style.padding    = "0px";
956             style.position   = "static";
957 
958             return element;
959         },
960 
961 
962         /**
963          * Returns the current milliseconds, using Date.now() if available
964          * @name $.now
965          * @function
966          */
967         now: function( ) {
968           if (Date.now) {
969             $.now = Date.now;
970           } else {
971             $.now = function() { return new Date().getTime(); };
972           }
973 
974           return $.now();
975         },
976 
977 
978         /**
979          * Ensures an image is loaded correctly to support alpha transparency.
980          * Generally only IE has issues doing this correctly for formats like
981          * png.
982          * @function
983          * @name OpenSeadragon.makeTransparentImage
984          * @param {String} src
985          * @returns {Element}
986          */
987         makeTransparentImage: function( src ) {
988 
989             $.makeTransparentImage = function( src ){
990                 var img = $.makeNeutralElement( "img" );
991 
992                 img.src = src;
993 
994                 return img;
995             };
996 
997             if ( $.Browser.vendor == $.BROWSERS.IE && $.Browser.version < 7 ) {
998 
999                 $.makeTransparentImage = function( src ){
1000                     var img     = $.makeNeutralElement( "img" ),
1001                         element = null;
1002 
1003                     element = $.makeNeutralElement("span");
1004                     element.style.display = "inline-block";
1005 
1006                     img.onload = function() {
1007                         element.style.width  = element.style.width || img.width + "px";
1008                         element.style.height = element.style.height || img.height + "px";
1009 
1010                         img.onload = null;
1011                         img = null;     // to prevent memory leaks in IE
1012                     };
1013 
1014                     img.src = src;
1015                     element.style.filter =
1016                         "progid:DXImageTransform.Microsoft.AlphaImageLoader(src='" +
1017                         src +
1018                         "', sizingMethod='scale')";
1019 
1020                     return element;
1021                 };
1022 
1023             }
1024 
1025             return $.makeTransparentImage( src );
1026         },
1027 
1028 
1029         /**
1030          * Sets the opacity of the specified element.
1031          * @function
1032          * @name OpenSeadragon.setElementOpacity
1033          * @param {Element|String} element
1034          * @param {Number} opacity
1035          * @param {Boolean} [usesAlpha]
1036          */
1037         setElementOpacity: function( element, opacity, usesAlpha ) {
1038 
1039             var ieOpacity,
1040                 ieFilter;
1041 
1042             element = $.getElement( element );
1043 
1044             if ( usesAlpha && !$.Browser.alpha ) {
1045                 opacity = Math.round( opacity );
1046             }
1047 
1048             if ( $.Browser.opacity ) {
1049                 element.style.opacity = opacity < 1 ? opacity : "";
1050             } else {
1051                 if ( opacity < 1 ) {
1052                     ieOpacity = Math.round( 100 * opacity );
1053                     ieFilter  = "alpha(opacity=" + ieOpacity + ")";
1054                     element.style.filter = ieFilter;
1055                 } else {
1056                     element.style.filter = "";
1057                 }
1058             }
1059         },
1060 
1061 
1062         /**
1063          * Add the specified CSS class to the element if not present.
1064          * @name $.addClass
1065          * @function
1066          * @param {Element|String} element
1067          * @param {String} className
1068          */
1069         addClass: function( element, className ) {
1070             element = $.getElement( element );
1071 
1072             if ( ! element.className ) {
1073                 element.className = className;
1074             } else if ( ( ' ' + element.className + ' ' ).
1075                 indexOf( ' ' + className + ' ' ) === -1 ) {
1076                 element.className += ' ' + className;
1077             }
1078         },
1079 
1080 
1081         /**
1082          * Remove the specified CSS class from the element.
1083          * @name $.removeClass
1084          * @function
1085          * @param {Element|String} element
1086          * @param {String} className
1087          */
1088         removeClass: function( element, className ) {
1089             var oldClasses,
1090                 newClasses = [],
1091                 i;
1092 
1093             element = $.getElement( element );
1094             oldClasses = element.className.split( /\s+/ );
1095             for ( i = 0; i < oldClasses.length; i++ ) {
1096                 if ( oldClasses[ i ] && oldClasses[ i ] !== className ) {
1097                     newClasses.push( oldClasses[ i ] );
1098                 }
1099             }
1100             element.className = newClasses.join(' ');
1101         },
1102 
1103 
1104         /**
1105          * Adds an event listener for the given element, eventName and handler.
1106          * @function
1107          * @name OpenSeadragon.addEvent
1108          * @param {Element|String} element
1109          * @param {String} eventName
1110          * @param {Function} handler
1111          * @param {Boolean} [useCapture]
1112          * @throws {Error}
1113          */
1114         addEvent: function( element, eventName, handler, useCapture ) {
1115             element = $.getElement( element );
1116 
1117             //TODO: Why do this if/else on every method call instead of just
1118             //      defining this function once based on the same logic
1119             if ( element.addEventListener ) {
1120                 $.addEvent = function( element, eventName, handler, useCapture ){
1121                     element = $.getElement( element );
1122                     element.addEventListener( eventName, handler, useCapture );
1123                 };
1124             } else if ( element.attachEvent ) {
1125                 $.addEvent = function( element, eventName, handler, useCapture ){
1126                     element = $.getElement( element );
1127                     element.attachEvent( "on" + eventName, handler );
1128                     if ( useCapture && element.setCapture ) {
1129                         element.setCapture();
1130                     }
1131                 };
1132             } else {
1133                 throw new Error(
1134                     "Unable to attach event handler, no known technique."
1135                 );
1136             }
1137 
1138             return $.addEvent( element, eventName, handler, useCapture );
1139         },
1140 
1141 
1142         /**
1143          * Remove a given event listener for the given element, event type and
1144          * handler.
1145          * @function
1146          * @name OpenSeadragon.removeEvent
1147          * @param {Element|String} element
1148          * @param {String} eventName
1149          * @param {Function} handler
1150          * @param {Boolean} [useCapture]
1151          * @throws {Error}
1152          */
1153         removeEvent: function( element, eventName, handler, useCapture ) {
1154             element = $.getElement( element );
1155 
1156             //TODO: Why do this if/else on every method call instead of just
1157             //      defining this function once based on the same logic
1158             if ( element.removeEventListener ) {
1159                 $.removeEvent = function( element, eventName, handler, useCapture ) {
1160                     element = $.getElement( element );
1161                     element.removeEventListener( eventName, handler, useCapture );
1162                 };
1163             } else if ( element.detachEvent ) {
1164                 $.removeEvent = function( element, eventName, handler, useCapture ) {
1165                     element = $.getElement( element );
1166                     element.detachEvent("on" + eventName, handler);
1167                     if ( useCapture && element.releaseCapture ) {
1168                         element.releaseCapture();
1169                     }
1170                 };
1171             } else {
1172                 throw new Error(
1173                     "Unable to detach event handler, no known technique."
1174                 );
1175             }
1176             return $.removeEvent( element, eventName, handler, useCapture );
1177         },
1178 
1179 
1180         /**
1181          * Cancels the default browser behavior had the event propagated all
1182          * the way up the DOM to the window object.
1183          * @function
1184          * @name OpenSeadragon.cancelEvent
1185          * @param {Event} [event]
1186          */
1187         cancelEvent: function( event ) {
1188             event = $.getEvent( event );
1189 
1190             if ( event.preventDefault ) {
1191                 $.cancelEvent = function( event ){
1192                     // W3C for preventing default
1193                     event.preventDefault();
1194                 };
1195             } else {
1196                 $.cancelEvent = function( event ){
1197                     event = $.getEvent( event );
1198                     // legacy for preventing default
1199                     event.cancel = true;
1200                     // IE for preventing default
1201                     event.returnValue = false;
1202                 };
1203             }
1204             $.cancelEvent( event );
1205         },
1206 
1207 
1208         /**
1209          * Stops the propagation of the event up the DOM.
1210          * @function
1211          * @name OpenSeadragon.stopEvent
1212          * @param {Event} [event]
1213          */
1214         stopEvent: function( event ) {
1215             event = $.getEvent( event );
1216 
1217             if ( event.stopPropagation ) {
1218                 // W3C for stopping propagation
1219                 $.stopEvent = function( event ){
1220                     event.stopPropagation();
1221                 };
1222             } else {
1223                 // IE for stopping propagation
1224                 $.stopEvent = function( event ){
1225                     event = $.getEvent( event );
1226                     event.cancelBubble = true;
1227                 };
1228 
1229             }
1230 
1231             $.stopEvent( event );
1232         },
1233 
1234 
1235         /**
1236          * Similar to OpenSeadragon.delegate, but it does not immediately call
1237          * the method on the object, returning a function which can be called
1238          * repeatedly to delegate the method. It also allows additonal arguments
1239          * to be passed during construction which will be added during each
1240          * invocation, and each invocation can add additional arguments as well.
1241          *
1242          * @function
1243          * @name OpenSeadragon.createCallback
1244          * @param {Object} object
1245          * @param {Function} method
1246          * @param [args] any additional arguments are passed as arguments to the
1247          *  created callback
1248          * @returns {Function}
1249          */
1250         createCallback: function( object, method ) {
1251             //TODO: This pattern is painful to use and debug.  It's much cleaner
1252             //      to use pinning plus anonymous functions.  Get rid of this
1253             //      pattern!
1254             var initialArgs = [],
1255                 i;
1256             for ( i = 2; i < arguments.length; i++ ) {
1257                 initialArgs.push( arguments[ i ] );
1258             }
1259 
1260             return function() {
1261                 var args = initialArgs.concat( [] ),
1262                     i;
1263                 for ( i = 0; i < arguments.length; i++ ) {
1264                     args.push( arguments[ i ] );
1265                 }
1266 
1267                 return method.apply( object, args );
1268             };
1269         },
1270 
1271 
1272         /**
1273          * Retreives the value of a url parameter from the window.location string.
1274          * @function
1275          * @name OpenSeadragon.getUrlParameter
1276          * @param {String} key
1277          * @returns {String} The value of the url parameter or null if no param matches.
1278          */
1279         getUrlParameter: function( key ) {
1280             var value = URLPARAMS[ key ];
1281             return value ? value : null;
1282         },
1283 
1284 
1285         createAjaxRequest: function(){
1286             var request;
1287 
1288             if ( window.XMLHttpRequest ) {
1289                 $.createAjaxRequest = function( ){
1290                     return new XMLHttpRequest();
1291                 };
1292                 request = new XMLHttpRequest();
1293             } else if ( window.ActiveXObject ) {
1294                 /*jshint loopfunc:true*/
1295                 /* global ActiveXObject:true */
1296                 for ( var i = 0; i < ACTIVEX.length; i++ ) {
1297                     try {
1298                         request = new ActiveXObject( ACTIVEX[ i ] );
1299                         $.createAjaxRequest = function( ){
1300                             return new ActiveXObject( ACTIVEX[ i ] );
1301                         };
1302                         break;
1303                     } catch (e) {
1304                         continue;
1305                     }
1306                 }
1307             }
1308 
1309             if ( !request ) {
1310                 throw new Error( "Browser doesn't support XMLHttpRequest." );
1311             }
1312 
1313             return request;
1314         },
1315 
1316 
1317         /**
1318          * Makes an AJAX request.
1319          * @function
1320          * @name OpenSeadragon.makeAjaxRequest
1321          * @param {String} url - the url to request
1322          * @param {Function} onSuccess - a function to call on a successful response
1323          * @param {Function} onError - a function to call on when an error occurs
1324          * @throws {Error}
1325          */
1326         makeAjaxRequest: function( url, onSuccess, onError ) {
1327             var request = $.createAjaxRequest();
1328 
1329             if ( !$.isFunction( onSuccess ) ) {
1330                 throw new Error( "makeAjaxRequest requires a success callback" );
1331             }
1332 
1333             request.onreadystatechange = function() {
1334                 // 4 = DONE (https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/XMLHttpRequest#Properties)
1335                 if ( request.readyState == 4 ) {
1336                     request.onreadystatechange = function(){};
1337 
1338                     if ( request.status == 200 ) {
1339                         onSuccess( request );
1340                     } else {
1341                         $.console.log( "AJAX request returned %s: %s", request.status, url );
1342 
1343                         if ( $.isFunction( onError ) ) {
1344                             onError( request );
1345                         }
1346                     }
1347                 }
1348             };
1349 
1350             try {
1351                 request.open( "GET", url, true );
1352                 request.send( null );
1353             } catch (e) {
1354                 var msg = e.message;
1355 
1356                 /*
1357                     IE < 10 does not support CORS and an XHR request to a different origin will fail as soon
1358                     as send() is called. This is particularly easy to miss during development and appear in
1359                     production if you use a CDN or domain sharding and the security policy is likely to break
1360                     exception handlers since any attempt to access a property of the request object will
1361                     raise an access denied TypeError inside the catch block.
1362 
1363                     To be friendlier, we'll check for this specific error and add a documentation pointer
1364                     to point developers in the right direction. We test the exception number because IE's
1365                     error messages are localized.
1366                 */
1367                 var oldIE = $.Browser.vendor == $.BROWSERS.IE && $.Browser.version < 10;
1368                 if ( oldIE && typeof( e.number ) != "undefined" && e.number == -2147024891 ) {
1369                     msg += "\nSee http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/ms537505(v=vs.85).aspx#xdomain";
1370                 }
1371 
1372                 $.console.log( "%s while making AJAX request: %s", e.name, msg );
1373 
1374                 request.onreadystatechange = function(){};
1375 
1376                 if ( $.isFunction( onError ) ) {
1377                     onError( request, e );
1378                 }
1379             }
1380         },
1381 
1382         /**
1383          * Taken from jQuery 1.6.1
1384          * @function
1385          * @name OpenSeadragon.jsonp
1386          * @param {Object} options
1387          * @param {String} options.url
1388          * @param {Function} options.callback
1389          * @param {String} [options.param='callback'] The name of the url parameter
1390          *      to request the jsonp provider with.
1391          * @param {String} [options.callbackName=] The name of the callback to
1392          *      request the jsonp provider with.
1393          */
1394         jsonp: function( options ){
1395             var script,
1396                 url     = options.url,
1397                 head    = document.head ||
1398                     document.getElementsByTagName( "head" )[ 0 ] ||
1399                     document.documentElement,
1400                 jsonpCallback = options.callbackName || 'openseadragon' + $.now(),
1401                 previous      = window[ jsonpCallback ],
1402                 replace       = "$1" + jsonpCallback + "$2",
1403                 callbackParam = options.param || 'callback',
1404                 callback      = options.callback;
1405 
1406             url = url.replace( /(\=)\?(&|$)|\?\?/i, replace );
1407             // Add callback manually
1408             url += (/\?/.test( url ) ? "&" : "?") + callbackParam + "=" + jsonpCallback;
1409 
1410             // Install callback
1411             window[ jsonpCallback ] = function( response ) {
1412                 if ( !previous ){
1413                     try{
1414                         delete window[ jsonpCallback ];
1415                     }catch(e){
1416                         //swallow
1417                     }
1418                 } else {
1419                     window[ jsonpCallback ] = previous;
1420                 }
1421                 if( callback && $.isFunction( callback ) ){
1422                     callback( response );
1423                 }
1424             };
1425 
1426             script = document.createElement( "script" );
1427 
1428             //TODO: having an issue with async info requests
1429             if( undefined !== options.async || false !== options.async ){
1430                 script.async = "async";
1431             }
1432 
1433             if ( options.scriptCharset ) {
1434                 script.charset = options.scriptCharset;
1435             }
1436 
1437             script.src = url;
1438 
1439             // Attach handlers for all browsers
1440             script.onload = script.onreadystatechange = function( _, isAbort ) {
1441 
1442                 if ( isAbort || !script.readyState || /loaded|complete/.test( script.readyState ) ) {
1443 
1444                     // Handle memory leak in IE
1445                     script.onload = script.onreadystatechange = null;
1446 
1447                     // Remove the script
1448                     if ( head && script.parentNode ) {
1449                         head.removeChild( script );
1450                     }
1451 
1452                     // Dereference the script
1453                     script = undefined;
1454                 }
1455             };
1456             // Use insertBefore instead of appendChild  to circumvent an IE6 bug.
1457             // This arises when a base node is used (#2709 and #4378).
1458             head.insertBefore( script, head.firstChild );
1459 
1460         },
1461 
1462 
1463         /**
1464          * Fully deprecated. Will throw an error.
1465          * @function
1466          * @name OpenSeadragon.createFromDZI
1467          * @deprecated - use OpenSeadragon.Viewer.prototype.open
1468          */
1469         createFromDZI: function() {
1470             throw "OpenSeadragon.createFromDZI is deprecated, use Viewer.open.";
1471         },
1472 
1473         /**
1474          * Parses an XML string into a DOM Document.
1475          * @function
1476          * @name OpenSeadragon.parseXml
1477          * @param {String} string
1478          * @returns {Document}
1479          */
1480         parseXml: function( string ) {
1481             //TODO: yet another example where we can determine the correct
1482             //      implementation once at start-up instead of everytime we use
1483             //      the function. DONE.
1484             if ( window.ActiveXObject ) {
1485 
1486                 $.parseXml = function( string ){
1487                     var xmlDoc = null;
1488 
1489                     xmlDoc = new ActiveXObject( "Microsoft.XMLDOM" );
1490                     xmlDoc.async = false;
1491                     xmlDoc.loadXML( string );
1492                     return xmlDoc;
1493                 };
1494 
1495             } else if ( window.DOMParser ) {
1496 
1497                 $.parseXml = function( string ){
1498                     var xmlDoc = null,
1499                         parser;
1500 
1501                     parser = new DOMParser();
1502                     xmlDoc = parser.parseFromString( string, "text/xml" );
1503                     return xmlDoc;
1504                 };
1505 
1506             } else {
1507                 throw new Error( "Browser doesn't support XML DOM." );
1508             }
1509 
1510             return $.parseXml( string );
1511         },
1512 
1513 
1514         /**
1515          * Reports whether the image format is supported for tiling in this
1516          * version.
1517          * @function
1518          * @name OpenSeadragon.imageFormatSupported
1519          * @param {String} [extension]
1520          * @returns {Boolean}
1521          */
1522         imageFormatSupported: function( extension ) {
1523             extension = extension ? extension : "";
1524             return !!FILEFORMATS[ extension.toLowerCase() ];
1525         }
1526 
1527     });
1528 
1529 
1530     /**
1531      * The current browser vendor, version, and related information regarding
1532      * detected features.  Features include <br/>
1533      *  <strong>'alpha'</strong> - Does the browser support image alpha
1534      *  transparency.<br/>
1535      * @name $.Browser
1536      * @static
1537      */
1538     $.Browser = {
1539         vendor:     $.BROWSERS.UNKNOWN,
1540         version:    0,
1541         alpha:      true
1542     };
1543 
1544 
1545     var ACTIVEX = [
1546             "Msxml2.XMLHTTP",
1547             "Msxml3.XMLHTTP",
1548             "Microsoft.XMLHTTP"
1549         ],
1550         FILEFORMATS = {
1551             "bmp":  false,
1552             "jpeg": true,
1553             "jpg":  true,
1554             "png":  true,
1555             "tif":  false,
1556             "wdp":  false
1557         },
1558         URLPARAMS = {};
1559 
1560     (function() {
1561         //A small auto-executing routine to determine the browser vendor,
1562         //version and supporting feature sets.
1563         var app = navigator.appName,
1564             ver = navigator.appVersion,
1565             ua  = navigator.userAgent;
1566 
1567         //console.error( 'appName: ' + navigator.appName );
1568         //console.error( 'appVersion: ' + navigator.appVersion );
1569         //console.error( 'userAgent: ' + navigator.userAgent );
1570 
1571         switch( navigator.appName ){
1572             case "Microsoft Internet Explorer":
1573                 if( !!window.attachEvent &&
1574                     !!window.ActiveXObject ) {
1575 
1576                     $.Browser.vendor = $.BROWSERS.IE;
1577                     $.Browser.version = parseFloat(
1578                         ua.substring(
1579                             ua.indexOf( "MSIE" ) + 5,
1580                             ua.indexOf( ";", ua.indexOf( "MSIE" ) ) )
1581                         );
1582                 }
1583                 break;
1584             case "Netscape":
1585                 if( !!window.addEventListener ){
1586                     if ( ua.indexOf( "Firefox" ) >= 0 ) {
1587                         $.Browser.vendor = $.BROWSERS.FIREFOX;
1588                         $.Browser.version = parseFloat(
1589                             ua.substring( ua.indexOf( "Firefox" ) + 8 )
1590                         );
1591                     } else if ( ua.indexOf( "Safari" ) >= 0 ) {
1592                         $.Browser.vendor = ua.indexOf( "Chrome" ) >= 0 ?
1593                             $.BROWSERS.CHROME :
1594                             $.BROWSERS.SAFARI;
1595                         $.Browser.version = parseFloat(
1596                             ua.substring(
1597                                 ua.substring( 0, ua.indexOf( "Safari" ) ).lastIndexOf( "/" ) + 1,
1598                                 ua.indexOf( "Safari" )
1599                             )
1600                         );
1601                     }
1602                 }
1603                 break;
1604             case "Opera":
1605                 $.Browser.vendor = $.BROWSERS.OPERA;
1606                 $.Browser.version = parseFloat( ver );
1607                 break;
1608         }
1609 
1610             // ignore '?' portion of query string
1611         var query = window.location.search.substring( 1 ),
1612             parts = query.split('&'),
1613             part,
1614             sep,
1615             i;
1616 
1617         for ( i = 0; i < parts.length; i++ ) {
1618             part = parts[ i ];
1619             sep  = part.indexOf( '=' );
1620 
1621             if ( sep > 0 ) {
1622                 URLPARAMS[ part.substring( 0, sep ) ] =
1623                     decodeURIComponent( part.substring( sep + 1 ) );
1624             }
1625         }
1626 
1627         //determine if this browser supports image alpha transparency
1628         $.Browser.alpha = !(
1629             (
1630                 $.Browser.vendor == $.BROWSERS.IE &&
1631                 $.Browser.version < 9
1632             ) || (
1633                 $.Browser.vendor == $.BROWSERS.CHROME &&
1634                 $.Browser.version < 2
1635             )
1636         );
1637 
1638         //determine if this browser supports element.style.opacity
1639         $.Browser.opacity = !(
1640             $.Browser.vendor == $.BROWSERS.IE &&
1641             $.Browser.version < 9
1642         );
1643 
1644     })();
1645 
1646 
1647     //TODO: $.console is often used inside a try/catch block which generally
1648     //      prevents allowings errors to occur with detection until a debugger
1649     //      is attached.  Although I've been guilty of the same anti-pattern
1650     //      I eventually was convinced that errors should naturally propogate in
1651     //      all but the most special cases.
1652     /**
1653      * A convenient alias for console when available, and a simple null
1654      * function when console is unavailable.
1655      * @static
1656      * @private
1657      */
1658     var nullfunction = function( msg ){
1659             //document.location.hash = msg;
1660         };
1661 
1662     $.console = window.console || {
1663         log:    nullfunction,
1664         debug:  nullfunction,
1665         info:   nullfunction,
1666         warn:   nullfunction,
1667         error:  nullfunction
1668     };
1669 
1670 
1671     // Adding support for HTML5's requestAnimationFrame as suggested by acdha.
1672     // Implementation taken from matt synder's post here:
1673     // http://mattsnider.com/cross-browser-and-legacy-supported-requestframeanimation/
1674     (function( w ) {
1675 
1676         // most browsers have an implementation
1677         var requestAnimationFrame = w.requestAnimationFrame ||
1678             w.mozRequestAnimationFrame ||
1679             w.webkitRequestAnimationFrame ||
1680             w.msRequestAnimationFrame;
1681 
1682         var cancelAnimationFrame = w.cancelAnimationFrame ||
1683             w.mozCancelAnimationFrame ||
1684             w.webkitCancelAnimationFrame ||
1685             w.msCancelAnimationFrame;
1686 
1687         // polyfill, when necessary
1688         if ( requestAnimationFrame && cancelAnimationFrame ) {
1689             // We can't assign these window methods directly to $ because they
1690             // expect their "this" to be "window", so we call them in wrappers.
1691             $.requestAnimationFrame = function(){
1692                 return requestAnimationFrame.apply( w, arguments );
1693             };
1694             $.cancelAnimationFrame = function(){
1695                 return cancelAnimationFrame.apply( w, arguments );
1696             };
1697         } else {
1698             var aAnimQueue = [],
1699                 processing = [],
1700                 iRequestId = 0,
1701                 iIntervalId;
1702 
1703             // create a mock requestAnimationFrame function
1704             $.requestAnimationFrame = function( callback ) {
1705                 aAnimQueue.push( [ ++iRequestId, callback ] );
1706 
1707                 if ( !iIntervalId ) {
1708                     iIntervalId = setInterval( function() {
1709                         if ( aAnimQueue.length ) {
1710                             var time = $.now();
1711                             // Process all of the currently outstanding frame
1712                             // requests, but none that get added during the
1713                             // processing.
1714                             // Swap the arrays so we don't have to create a new
1715                             // array every frame.
1716                             var temp = processing;
1717                             processing = aAnimQueue;
1718                             aAnimQueue = temp;
1719                             while ( processing.length ) {
1720                                 processing.shift()[ 1 ]( time );
1721                             }
1722                         } else {
1723                             // don't continue the interval, if unnecessary
1724                             clearInterval( iIntervalId );
1725                             iIntervalId = undefined;
1726                         }
1727                     }, 1000 / 50);  // estimating support for 50 frames per second
1728                 }
1729 
1730                 return iRequestId;
1731             };
1732 
1733             // create a mock cancelAnimationFrame function
1734             $.cancelAnimationFrame = function( requestId ) {
1735                 // find the request ID and remove it
1736                 var i, j;
1737                 for ( i = 0, j = aAnimQueue.length; i < j; i += 1 ) {
1738                     if ( aAnimQueue[ i ][ 0 ] === requestId ) {
1739                         aAnimQueue.splice( i, 1 );
1740                         return;
1741                     }
1742                 }
1743 
1744                 // If it's not in the queue, it may be in the set we're currently
1745                 // processing (if cancelAnimationFrame is called from within a
1746                 // requestAnimationFrame callback).
1747                 for ( i = 0, j = processing.length; i < j; i += 1 ) {
1748                     if ( processing[ i ][ 0 ] === requestId ) {
1749                         processing.splice( i, 1 );
1750                         return;
1751                     }
1752                 }
1753             };
1754         }
1755     })( window );
1756 
1757     /**
1758      * @private
1759      * @inner
1760      * @function
1761      * @param {Element} element
1762      * @param {Boolean} [isFixed]
1763      * @returns {Element}
1764      */
1765     function getOffsetParent( element, isFixed ) {
1766         if ( isFixed && element != document.body ) {
1767             return document.body;
1768         } else {
1769             return element.offsetParent;
1770         }
1771     }
1772 
1773     /**
1774      * @private
1775      * @inner
1776      * @function
1777      * @param {XMLHttpRequest} xhr
1778      * @param {String} tilesUrl
1779      * @deprecated
1780      */
1781     function processDZIResponse( xhr, tilesUrl ) {
1782         var status,
1783             statusText,
1784             doc = null;
1785 
1786         if ( !xhr ) {
1787             throw new Error( $.getString( "Errors.Security" ) );
1788         } else if ( xhr.status !== 200 && xhr.status !== 0 ) {
1789             status     = xhr.status;
1790             statusText = ( status == 404 ) ?
1791                 "Not Found" :
1792                 xhr.statusText;
1793             throw new Error( $.getString( "Errors.Status", status, statusText ) );
1794         }
1795 
1796         if ( xhr.responseXML && xhr.responseXML.documentElement ) {
1797             doc = xhr.responseXML;
1798         } else if ( xhr.responseText ) {
1799             doc = $.parseXml( xhr.responseText );
1800         }
1801 
1802         return processDZIXml( doc, tilesUrl );
1803     }
1804 
1805     /**
1806      * @private
1807      * @inner
1808      * @function
1809      * @param {Document} xmlDoc
1810      * @param {String} tilesUrl
1811      * @deprecated
1812      */
1813     function processDZIXml( xmlDoc, tilesUrl ) {
1814 
1815         if ( !xmlDoc || !xmlDoc.documentElement ) {
1816             throw new Error( $.getString( "Errors.Xml" ) );
1817         }
1818 
1819         var root     = xmlDoc.documentElement,
1820             rootName = root.tagName;
1821 
1822         if ( rootName == "Image" ) {
1823             try {
1824                 return processDZI( root, tilesUrl );
1825             } catch ( e ) {
1826                 throw (e instanceof Error) ?
1827                     e :
1828                     new Error( $.getString("Errors.Dzi") );
1829             }
1830         } else if ( rootName == "Collection" ) {
1831             throw new Error( $.getString( "Errors.Dzc" ) );
1832         } else if ( rootName == "Error" ) {
1833             return $._processDZIError( root );
1834         }
1835 
1836         throw new Error( $.getString( "Errors.Dzi" ) );
1837     }
1838 
1839     /**
1840      * @private
1841      * @inner
1842      * @function
1843      * @param {Element} imageNode
1844      * @param {String} tilesUrl
1845      * @deprecated
1846      */
1847     function processDZI( imageNode, tilesUrl ) {
1848         var fileFormat    = imageNode.getAttribute( "Format" ),
1849             sizeNode      = imageNode.getElementsByTagName( "Size" )[ 0 ],
1850             dispRectNodes = imageNode.getElementsByTagName( "DisplayRect" ),
1851             width         = parseInt( sizeNode.getAttribute( "Width" ), 10 ),
1852             height        = parseInt( sizeNode.getAttribute( "Height" ), 10 ),
1853             tileSize      = parseInt( imageNode.getAttribute( "TileSize" ), 10 ),
1854             tileOverlap   = parseInt( imageNode.getAttribute( "Overlap" ), 10 ),
1855             dispRects     = [],
1856             dispRectNode,
1857             rectNode,
1858             i;
1859 
1860         if ( !$.imageFormatSupported( fileFormat ) ) {
1861             throw new Error(
1862                 $.getString( "Errors.ImageFormat", fileFormat.toUpperCase() )
1863             );
1864         }
1865 
1866         for ( i = 0; i < dispRectNodes.length; i++ ) {
1867             dispRectNode = dispRectNodes[ i ];
1868             rectNode     = dispRectNode.getElementsByTagName( "Rect" )[ 0 ];
1869 
1870             dispRects.push( new $.DisplayRect(
1871                 parseInt( rectNode.getAttribute( "X" ), 10 ),
1872                 parseInt( rectNode.getAttribute( "Y" ), 10 ),
1873                 parseInt( rectNode.getAttribute( "Width" ), 10 ),
1874                 parseInt( rectNode.getAttribute( "Height" ), 10 ),
1875                 0,  // ignore MinLevel attribute, bug in Deep Zoom Composer
1876                 parseInt( dispRectNode.getAttribute( "MaxLevel" ), 10 )
1877             ));
1878         }
1879         return new $.DziTileSource(
1880             width,
1881             height,
1882             tileSize,
1883             tileOverlap,
1884             tilesUrl,
1885             fileFormat,
1886             dispRects
1887         );
1888     }
1889 
1890     /**
1891      * @private
1892      * @inner
1893      * @function
1894      * @param {Element} imageNode
1895      * @param {String} tilesUrl
1896      * @deprecated
1897      */
1898     function processDZIJSON( imageData, tilesUrl ) {
1899         var fileFormat    = imageData.Format,
1900             sizeData      = imageData.Size,
1901             dispRectData  = imageData.DisplayRect || [],
1902             width         = parseInt( sizeData.Width, 10 ),
1903             height        = parseInt( sizeData.Height, 10 ),
1904             tileSize      = parseInt( imageData.TileSize, 10 ),
1905             tileOverlap   = parseInt( imageData.Overlap, 10 ),
1906             dispRects     = [],
1907             rectData,
1908             i;
1909 
1910         if ( !$.imageFormatSupported( fileFormat ) ) {
1911             throw new Error(
1912                 $.getString( "Errors.ImageFormat", fileFormat.toUpperCase() )
1913             );
1914         }
1915 
1916         for ( i = 0; i < dispRectData.length; i++ ) {
1917             rectData     = dispRectData[ i ].Rect;
1918 
1919             dispRects.push( new $.DisplayRect(
1920                 parseInt( rectData.X, 10 ),
1921                 parseInt( rectData.Y, 10 ),
1922                 parseInt( rectData.Width, 10 ),
1923                 parseInt( rectData.Height, 10 ),
1924                 0,  // ignore MinLevel attribute, bug in Deep Zoom Composer
1925                 parseInt( rectData.MaxLevel, 10 )
1926             ));
1927         }
1928         return new $.DziTileSource(
1929             width,
1930             height,
1931             tileSize,
1932             tileOverlap,
1933             tilesUrl,
1934             fileFormat,
1935             dispRects
1936         );
1937     }
1938 
1939     /**
1940      * @private
1941      * @inner
1942      * @function
1943      * @param {Document} errorNode
1944      * @throws {Error}
1945      * @deprecated
1946      */
1947     $._processDZIError = function ( errorNode ) {
1948         var messageNode = errorNode.getElementsByTagName( "Message" )[ 0 ],
1949             message     = messageNode.firstChild.nodeValue;
1950 
1951         throw new Error(message);
1952     };
1953 
1954 }( OpenSeadragon ));
1955

1990 /*
1991  * Implementation and research by John Dyer in:
1992  * http://johndyer.name/native-fullscreen-javascript-api-plus-jquery-plugin/
1993  * John Dyer has released this fullscreen code under the MIT license; see
1994  * <https://github.com/openseadragon/openseadragon/issues/81>.
1995  *
1996  * Copyright (C) 2011 John Dyer
1997  *
1998  * Permission is hereby granted, free of charge, to any person obtaining a
1999  * copy of this software and associated documentation files (the "Software"),
2000  * to deal in the Software without restriction, including without limitation
2001  * the rights to use, copy, modify, merge, publish, distribute, sublicense,
2002  * and/or sell copies of the Software, and to permit persons to whom the
2003  * Software is furnished to do so, subject to the following conditions:
2004  *
2005  * The above copyright notice and this permission notice shall be included
2006  * in all copies or substantial portions of the Software.
2007  *
2008  * THE SOFTWARE IS PROVIDED "AS IS", WITHOUT WARRANTY OF ANY KIND, EXPRESS
2009  * OR IMPLIED, INCLUDING BUT NOT LIMITED TO THE WARRANTIES OF
2010  * MERCHANTABILITY, FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE AND NONINFRINGEMENT.
2011  * IN NO EVENT SHALL THE AUTHORS OR COPYRIGHT HOLDERS BE LIABLE FOR ANY
2012  * CLAIM, DAMAGES OR OTHER LIABILITY, WHETHER IN AN ACTION OF CONTRACT, TORT
2013  * OR OTHERWISE, ARISING FROM, OUT OF OR IN CONNECTION WITH THE SOFTWARE OR
2014  * THE USE OR OTHER DEALINGS IN THE SOFTWARE.
2015  */
