9425 
9426 (function( $ ){
9427 
9428 /**
9429  * A display rectanlge is very similar to the OpenSeadragon.Rect but adds two
9430  * fields, 'minLevel' and 'maxLevel' which denote the supported zoom levels
9431  * for this rectangle.
9432  * @class
9433  * @extends OpenSeadragon.Rect
9434  * @param {Number} x The vector component 'x'.
9435  * @param {Number} y The vector component 'y'.
9436  * @param {Number} width The vector component 'height'.
9437  * @param {Number} height The vector component 'width'.
9438  * @param {Number} minLevel The lowest zoom level supported.
9439  * @param {Number} maxLevel The highest zoom level supported.
9440  * @property {Number} minLevel The lowest zoom level supported.
9441  * @property {Number} maxLevel The highest zoom level supported.
9442  */
9443 $.DisplayRect = function( x, y, width, height, minLevel, maxLevel ) {
9444     $.Rect.apply( this, [ x, y, width, height ] );
9445 
9446     this.minLevel = minLevel;
9447     this.maxLevel = maxLevel;
9448 };
9449 
9450 $.extend( $.DisplayRect.prototype, $.Rect.prototype );
9451 
9452 }( OpenSeadragon ));
9453 
9454 /*
9455  * OpenSeadragon - Spring
9456  *
9457  * Copyright (C) 2009 CodePlex Foundation
9458  * Copyright (C) 2010-2013 OpenSeadragon contributors
9459  *
9460  * Redistribution and use in source and binary forms, with or without
9461  * modification, are permitted provided that the following conditions are
9462  * met:
9463  *
9464  * - Redistributions of source code must retain the above copyright notice,
9465  *   this list of conditions and the following disclaimer.
9466  *
9467  * - Redistributions in binary form must reproduce the above copyright
9468  *   notice, this list of conditions and the following disclaimer in the
9469  *   documentation and/or other materials provided with the distribution.
9470  *
9471  * - Neither the name of CodePlex Foundation nor the names of its
9472  *   contributors may be used to endorse or promote products derived from
9473  *   this software without specific prior written permission.
9474  *
9475  * THIS SOFTWARE IS PROVIDED BY THE COPYRIGHT HOLDERS AND CONTRIBUTORS
9476  * "AS IS" AND ANY EXPRESS OR IMPLIED WARRANTIES, INCLUDING, BUT NOT
9477  * LIMITED TO, THE IMPLIED WARRANTIES OF MERCHANTABILITY AND FITNESS FOR
9478  * A PARTICULAR PURPOSE ARE DISCLAIMED.  IN NO EVENT SHALL THE COPYRIGHT
9479  * OWNER OR CONTRIBUTORS BE LIABLE FOR ANY DIRECT, INDIRECT, INCIDENTAL,
9480  * SPECIAL, EXEMPLARY, OR CONSEQUENTIAL DAMAGES (INCLUDING, BUT NOT LIMITED
9481  * TO, PROCUREMENT OF SUBSTITUTE GOODS OR SERVICES; LOSS OF USE, DATA, OR
9482  * PROFITS; OR BUSINESS INTERRUPTION) HOWEVER CAUSED AND ON ANY THEORY OF
9483  * LIABILITY, WHETHER IN CONTRACT, STRICT LIABILITY, OR TORT (INCLUDING
9484  * NEGLIGENCE OR OTHERWISE) ARISING IN ANY WAY OUT OF THE USE OF THIS
9485  * SOFTWARE, EVEN IF ADVISED OF THE POSSIBILITY OF SUCH DAMAGE.
9486  */
9487 
9488 (function( $ ){
9489 
9490 /**
9491  * @class
9492  * @param {Object} options - Spring configuration settings.
9493  * @param {Number} options.initial - Initial value of spring, default to 0 so
9494  *  spring is not in motion initally by default.
9495  * @param {Number} options.springStiffness - Spring stiffness.
9496  * @param {Number} options.animationTime - Animation duration per spring.
9497  *
9498  * @property {Number} initial - Initial value of spring, default to 0 so
9499  *  spring is not in motion initally by default.
9500  * @property {Number} springStiffness - Spring stiffness.
9501  * @property {Number} animationTime - Animation duration per spring.
9502  * @property {Object} current
9503  * @property {Number} start
9504  * @property {Number} target
9505  */
9506 $.Spring = function( options ) {
9507     var args = arguments;
9508 
9509     if( typeof( options ) != 'object' ){
9510         //allows backward compatible use of ( initialValue, config ) as
9511         //constructor parameters
9512         options = {
9513             initial: args.length && typeof ( args[ 0 ] ) == "number" ?
9514                 args[ 0 ] :
9515                 0,
9516             springStiffness: args.length > 1 ?
9517                 args[ 1 ].springStiffness :
9518                 5.0,
9519             animationTime: args.length > 1 ?
9520                 args[ 1 ].animationTime :
9521                 1.5
9522         };
9523     }
9524 
9525     $.extend( true, this, options);
9526 
9527 
9528     this.current = {
9529         value: typeof ( this.initial ) == "number" ?
9530             this.initial :
9531             0,
9532         time:  $.now() // always work in milliseconds
9533     };
9534 
9535     this.start = {
9536         value: this.current.value,
9537         time:  this.current.time
9538     };
9539 
9540     this.target = {
9541         value: this.current.value,
9542         time:  this.current.time
9543     };
9544 };
9545 
9546 $.Spring.prototype = {
9547 
9548     /**
9549      * @function
9550      * @param {Number} target
9551      */
9552     resetTo: function( target ) {
9553         this.target.value = target;
9554         this.target.time  = this.current.time;
9555         this.start.value  = this.target.value;
9556         this.start.time   = this.target.time;
9557     },
9558 
9559     /**
9560      * @function
9561      * @param {Number} target
9562      */
9563     springTo: function( target ) {
9564         this.start.value  = this.current.value;
9565         this.start.time   = this.current.time;
9566         this.target.value = target;
9567         this.target.time  = this.start.time + 1000 * this.animationTime;
9568     },
9569 
9570     /**
9571      * @function
9572      * @param {Number} delta
9573      */
9574     shiftBy: function( delta ) {
9575         this.start.value  += delta;
9576         this.target.value += delta;
9577     },
9578 
9579     /**
9580      * @function
9581      */
9582     update: function() {
9583         this.current.time  = $.now();
9584         this.current.value = (this.current.time >= this.target.time) ?
9585             this.target.value :
9586             this.start.value +
9587                 ( this.target.value - this.start.value ) *
9588                 transform(
9589                     this.springStiffness,
9590                     ( this.current.time - this.start.time ) /
9591                     ( this.target.time  - this.start.time )
9592                 );
9593     }
9594 };
9595 
9596 /**
9597  * @private
9598  */
9599 function transform( stiffness, x ) {
9600     return ( 1.0 - Math.exp( stiffness * -x ) ) /
9601         ( 1.0 - Math.exp( -stiffness ) );
9602 }
9603 
9604 }( OpenSeadragon ));
9605 
9606 /*
9607  * OpenSeadragon - Tile
9608  *
9609  * Copyright (C) 2009 CodePlex Foundation
9610  * Copyright (C) 2010-2013 OpenSeadragon contributors
9611  *
9612  * Redistribution and use in source and binary forms, with or without
9613  * modification, are permitted provided that the following conditions are
9614  * met:
9615  *
9616  * - Redistributions of source code must retain the above copyright notice,
9617  *   this list of conditions and the following disclaimer.
9618  *
9619  * - Redistributions in binary form must reproduce the above copyright
9620  *   notice, this list of conditions and the following disclaimer in the
9621  *   documentation and/or other materials provided with the distribution.
9622  *
9623  * - Neither the name of CodePlex Foundation nor the names of its
9624  *   contributors may be used to endorse or promote products derived from
9625  *   this software without specific prior written permission.
9626  *
9627  * THIS SOFTWARE IS PROVIDED BY THE COPYRIGHT HOLDERS AND CONTRIBUTORS
9628  * "AS IS" AND ANY EXPRESS OR IMPLIED WARRANTIES, INCLUDING, BUT NOT
9629  * LIMITED TO, THE IMPLIED WARRANTIES OF MERCHANTABILITY AND FITNESS FOR
9630  * A PARTICULAR PURPOSE ARE DISCLAIMED.  IN NO EVENT SHALL THE COPYRIGHT
9631  * OWNER OR CONTRIBUTORS BE LIABLE FOR ANY DIRECT, INDIRECT, INCIDENTAL,
9632  * SPECIAL, EXEMPLARY, OR CONSEQUENTIAL DAMAGES (INCLUDING, BUT NOT LIMITED
9633  * TO, PROCUREMENT OF SUBSTITUTE GOODS OR SERVICES; LOSS OF USE, DATA, OR
9634  * PROFITS; OR BUSINESS INTERRUPTION) HOWEVER CAUSED AND ON ANY THEORY OF
9635  * LIABILITY, WHETHER IN CONTRACT, STRICT LIABILITY, OR TORT (INCLUDING
9636  * NEGLIGENCE OR OTHERWISE) ARISING IN ANY WAY OUT OF THE USE OF THIS
9637  * SOFTWARE, EVEN IF ADVISED OF THE POSSIBILITY OF SUCH DAMAGE.
9638  */
9639 
9640 (function( $ ){
9641     var TILE_CACHE       = {};
9642 /**
9643  * @class
9644  * @param {Number} level The zoom level this tile belongs to.
9645  * @param {Number} x The vector component 'x'.
9646  * @param {Number} y The vector component 'y'.
9647  * @param {OpenSeadragon.Point} bounds Where this tile fits, in normalized
9648  *      coordinates.
9649  * @param {Boolean} exists Is this tile a part of a sparse image? ( Also has
9650  *      this tile failed to load? )
9651  * @param {String} url The URL of this tile's image.
9652  *
9653  * @property {Number} level The zoom level this tile belongs to.
9654  * @property {Number} x The vector component 'x'.
9655  * @property {Number} y The vector component 'y'.
9656  * @property {OpenSeadragon.Point} bounds Where this tile fits, in normalized
9657  *      coordinates
9658  * @property {Boolean} exists Is this tile a part of a sparse image? ( Also has
9659  *      this tile failed to load?
9660  * @property {String} url The URL of this tile's image.
9661  * @property {Boolean} loaded Is this tile loaded?
9662  * @property {Boolean} loading Is this tile loading
9663  * @property {Element} element The HTML element for this tile
9664  * @property {Image} image The Image object for this tile
9665  * @property {String} style The alias of this.element.style.
9666  * @property {String} position This tile's position on screen, in pixels.
9667  * @property {String} size This tile's size on screen, in pixels
9668  * @property {String} blendStart The start time of this tile's blending
9669  * @property {String} opacity The current opacity this tile should be.
9670  * @property {String} distance The distance of this tile to the viewport center
9671  * @property {String} visibility The visibility score of this tile.
9672  * @property {Boolean} beingDrawn Whether this tile is currently being drawn
9673  * @property {Number} lastTouchTime Timestamp the tile was last touched.
9674  */
9675 $.Tile = function(level, x, y, bounds, exists, url) {
9676     this.level   = level;
9677     this.x       = x;
9678     this.y       = y;
9679     this.bounds  = bounds;
9680     this.exists  = exists;
9681     this.url     = url;
9682     this.loaded  = false;
9683     this.loading = false;
9684 
9685     this.element    = null;
9686     this.image      = null;
9687 
9688     this.style      = null;
9689     this.position   = null;
9690     this.size       = null;
9691     this.blendStart = null;
9692     this.opacity    = null;
9693     this.distance   = null;
9694     this.visibility = null;
9695 
9696     this.beingDrawn     = false;
9697     this.lastTouchTime  = 0;
9698 };
9699 
9700 $.Tile.prototype = {
9701 
9702     /**
9703      * Provides a string representation of this tiles level and (x,y)
9704      * components.
9705      * @function
9706      * @returns {String}
9707      */
9708     toString: function() {
9709         return this.level + "/" + this.x + "_" + this.y;
9710     },
9711 
9712     /**
9713      * Renders the tile in an html container.
9714      * @function
9715      * @param {Element} container
9716      */
9717     drawHTML: function( container ) {
9718         if ( !this.loaded || !this.image ) {
9719             $.console.warn(
9720                 "Attempting to draw tile %s when it's not yet loaded.",
9721                 this.toString()
9722             );
9723             return;
9724         }
9725 
9726         //EXPERIMENTAL - trying to figure out how to scale the container
9727         //               content during animation of the container size.
9728 
9729         if ( !this.element ) {
9730             this.element              = $.makeNeutralElement("img");
9731             this.element.src          = this.url;
9732             this.element.style.msInterpolationMode = "nearest-neighbor";
9733 
9734             this.style                     = this.element.style;
9735             this.style.position            = "absolute";
9736         }
9737         if ( this.element.parentNode != container ) {
9738             container.appendChild( this.element );
9739         }
9740 
9741         this.style.top     = this.position.y + "px";
9742         this.style.left    = this.position.x + "px";
9743         this.style.height  = this.size.y + "px";
9744         this.style.width   = this.size.x + "px";
9745 
9746         $.setElementOpacity( this.element, this.opacity );
9747     },
9748 
9749     /**
9750      * Renders the tile in a canvas-based context.
9751      * @function
9752      * @param {Canvas} context
9753      */
9754     drawCanvas: function( context ) {
9755 
9756         var position = this.position,
9757             size     = this.size,
9758             rendered,
9759             canvas;
9760 
9761         if ( !this.loaded || !( this.image || TILE_CACHE[ this.url ] ) ){
9762             $.console.warn(
9763                 "Attempting to draw tile %s when it's not yet loaded.",
9764                 this.toString()
9765             );
9766             return;
9767         }
9768         context.globalAlpha = this.opacity;
9769 
9770         //context.save();
9771 
9772         //if we are supposed to be rendering fully opaque rectangle,
9773         //ie its done fading or fading is turned off, and if we are drawing
9774         //an image with an alpha channel, then the only way
9775         //to avoid seeing the tile underneath is to clear the rectangle
9776         if( context.globalAlpha == 1 && this.url.match('.png') ){
9777             //clearing only the inside of the rectangle occupied
9778             //by the png prevents edge flikering
9779             context.clearRect(
9780                 position.x+1,
9781                 position.y+1,
9782                 size.x-2,
9783                 size.y-2
9784             );
9785 
9786         }
9787 
9788         if( !TILE_CACHE[ this.url ] ){
9789             canvas = document.createElement( 'canvas' );
9790             canvas.width = this.image.width;
9791             canvas.height = this.image.height;
9792             rendered = canvas.getContext('2d');
9793             rendered.drawImage( this.image, 0, 0 );
9794             TILE_CACHE[ this.url ] = rendered;
9795             //since we are caching the prerendered image on a canvas
9796             //allow the image to not be held in memory
9797             this.image = null;
9798         }
9799 
9800         rendered = TILE_CACHE[ this.url ];
9801 
9802         //rendered.save();
9803         context.drawImage(
9804             rendered.canvas,
9805             0,
9806             0,
9807             rendered.canvas.width,
9808             rendered.canvas.height,
9809             position.x,
9810             position.y,
9811             size.x,
9812             size.y
9813         );
9814         //rendered.restore();
9815 
9816         //context.restore();
9817     },
9818 
9819     /**
9820      * Removes tile from it's contianer.
9821      * @function
9822      */
9823     unload: function() {
9824         if ( this.element && this.element.parentNode ) {
9825             this.element.parentNode.removeChild( this.element );
9826         }
9827         if ( TILE_CACHE[ this.url ]){
9828             delete TILE_CACHE[ this.url ];
9829         }
9830 
9831         this.element = null;
9832         this.image   = null;
9833         this.loaded  = false;
9834         this.loading = false;
9835     }
9836 };
9837 
9838 }( OpenSeadragon ));
9839 
9840 /*
9841  * OpenSeadragon - Overlay
9842  *
9843  * Copyright (C) 2009 CodePlex Foundation
9844  * Copyright (C) 2010-2013 OpenSeadragon contributors
9845  *
9846  * Redistribution and use in source and binary forms, with or without
9847  * modification, are permitted provided that the following conditions are
9848  * met:
9849  *
9850  * - Redistributions of source code must retain the above copyright notice,
9851  *   this list of conditions and the following disclaimer.
9852  *
9853  * - Redistributions in binary form must reproduce the above copyright
9854  *   notice, this list of conditions and the following disclaimer in the
9855  *   documentation and/or other materials provided with the distribution.
9856  *
9857  * - Neither the name of CodePlex Foundation nor the names of its
9858  *   contributors may be used to endorse or promote products derived from
9859  *   this software without specific prior written permission.
9860  *
9861  * THIS SOFTWARE IS PROVIDED BY THE COPYRIGHT HOLDERS AND CONTRIBUTORS
9862  * "AS IS" AND ANY EXPRESS OR IMPLIED WARRANTIES, INCLUDING, BUT NOT
9863  * LIMITED TO, THE IMPLIED WARRANTIES OF MERCHANTABILITY AND FITNESS FOR
9864  * A PARTICULAR PURPOSE ARE DISCLAIMED.  IN NO EVENT SHALL THE COPYRIGHT
9865  * OWNER OR CONTRIBUTORS BE LIABLE FOR ANY DIRECT, INDIRECT, INCIDENTAL,
9866  * SPECIAL, EXEMPLARY, OR CONSEQUENTIAL DAMAGES (INCLUDING, BUT NOT LIMITED
9867  * TO, PROCUREMENT OF SUBSTITUTE GOODS OR SERVICES; LOSS OF USE, DATA, OR
9868  * PROFITS; OR BUSINESS INTERRUPTION) HOWEVER CAUSED AND ON ANY THEORY OF
9869  * LIABILITY, WHETHER IN CONTRACT, STRICT LIABILITY, OR TORT (INCLUDING
9870  * NEGLIGENCE OR OTHERWISE) ARISING IN ANY WAY OUT OF THE USE OF THIS
9871  * SOFTWARE, EVEN IF ADVISED OF THE POSSIBILITY OF SUCH DAMAGE.
9872  */
9873 
9874 (function( $ ){
9875 
9876     /**
9877      * An enumeration of positions that an overlay may be assigned relative
9878      * to the viewport including CENTER, TOP_LEFT (default), TOP, TOP_RIGHT,
9879      * RIGHT, BOTTOM_RIGHT, BOTTOM, BOTTOM_LEFT, and LEFT.
9880      * @static
9881      */
9882     $.OverlayPlacement = {
9883         CENTER:       0,
9884         TOP_LEFT:     1,
9885         TOP:          2,
9886         TOP_RIGHT:    3,
9887         RIGHT:        4,
9888         BOTTOM_RIGHT: 5,
9889         BOTTOM:       6,
9890         BOTTOM_LEFT:  7,
9891         LEFT:         8
9892     };
9893 
9894     /**
9895      * An Overlay provides a
9896      * @class
9897      */
9898     $.Overlay = function( element, location, placement ) {
9899 
9900         var options;
9901         if( $.isPlainObject( element ) ){
9902             options = element;
9903         } else{
9904             options = {
9905                 element: element,
9906                 location: location,
9907                 placement: placement
9908             };
9909         }
9910         
9911         this.element    = options.element;
9912         this.scales     = options.location instanceof $.Rect;
9913         this.bounds     = new $.Rect(
9914             options.location.x,
9915             options.location.y,
9916             options.location.width,
9917             options.location.height
9918         );
9919         this.position   = new $.Point(
9920             options.location.x,
9921             options.location.y
9922         );
9923         this.size       = new $.Point(
9924             options.location.width,
9925             options.location.height
9926         );
9927         this.style      = options.element.style;
9928         // rects are always top-left
9929         this.placement  = options.location instanceof $.Point ?
9930             options.placement :
9931             $.OverlayPlacement.TOP_LEFT;
9932         this.onDraw = options.onDraw;
9933     };
9934 
9935     $.Overlay.prototype = {
9936 
9937         /**
9938          * @function
9939          * @param {OpenSeadragon.OverlayPlacement} position
9940          * @param {OpenSeadragon.Point} size
9941          */
9942         adjust: function( position, size ) {
9943             switch ( this.placement ) {
9944                 case $.OverlayPlacement.TOP_LEFT:
9945                     break;
9946                 case $.OverlayPlacement.TOP:
9947                     position.x -= size.x / 2;
9948                     break;
9949                 case $.OverlayPlacement.TOP_RIGHT:
9950                     position.x -= size.x;
9951                     break;
9952                 case $.OverlayPlacement.RIGHT:
9953                     position.x -= size.x;
9954                     position.y -= size.y / 2;
9955                     break;
9956                 case $.OverlayPlacement.BOTTOM_RIGHT:
9957                     position.x -= size.x;
9958                     position.y -= size.y;
9959                     break;
9960                 case $.OverlayPlacement.BOTTOM:
9961                     position.x -= size.x / 2;
9962                     position.y -= size.y;
9963                     break;
9964                 case $.OverlayPlacement.BOTTOM_LEFT:
9965                     position.y -= size.y;
9966                     break;
9967                 case $.OverlayPlacement.LEFT:
9968                     position.y -= size.y / 2;
9969                     break;
9970                 default:
9971                 case $.OverlayPlacement.CENTER:
9972                     position.x -= size.x / 2;
9973                     position.y -= size.y / 2;
9974                     break;
9975             }
9976         },
9977 
9978         /**
9979          * @function
9980          */
9981         destroy: function() {
9982             var element = this.element,
9983                 style   = this.style;
9984 
9985             if ( element.parentNode ) {
9986                 element.parentNode.removeChild( element );
9987                 //this should allow us to preserve overlays when required between
9988                 //pages
9989                 if( element.prevElementParent ){
9990                     style.display = 'none';
9991                     //element.prevElementParent.insertBefore(
9992                     //    element,
9993                     //    element.prevNextSibling
9994                     //);
9995                     document.body.appendChild( element );
9996                 }
9997             }
9998 
9999             // clear the onDraw callback
10000             this.onDraw = null;
10001 
10002             style.top = "";
10003             style.left = "";
10004             style.position = "";
10005 
10006             if ( this.scales ) {
10007                 style.width = "";
10008                 style.height = "";
10009             }
10010         },
10011 
10012         /**
10013          * @function
10014          * @param {Element} container
10015          */
10016         drawHTML: function( container, viewport ) {
10017             var element = this.element,
10018                 style   = this.style,
10019                 scales  = this.scales,
10020                 drawerCenter = new $.Point(
10021                     viewport.viewer.drawer.canvas.width / 2,
10022                     viewport.viewer.drawer.canvas.height / 2
10023                 ),
10024                 degrees = viewport.degrees,
10025                 position,
10026                 size,
10027                 overlayCenter;
10028 
10029             if ( element.parentNode != container ) {
10030                 //save the source parent for later if we need it
10031                 element.prevElementParent  = element.parentNode;
10032                 element.prevNextSibling    = element.nextSibling;
10033                 container.appendChild( element );
10034             }
10035 
10036             if ( !scales ) {
10037                 this.size = $.getElementSize( element );
10038             }
10039 
10040             position = this.position;
10041             size     = this.size;
10042 
10043             this.adjust( position, size );
10044 
10045             position = position.apply( Math.floor );
10046             size     = size.apply( Math.ceil );
10047 
10048             // rotate the position of the overlay
10049             // TODO only rotate overlays if in canvas mode
10050             // TODO replace the size rotation with CSS3 transforms
10051             // TODO add an option to overlays to not rotate with the image
10052             // Currently only rotates position and size
10053             if( degrees !== 0 && this.scales ) {
10054                 overlayCenter = new $.Point( size.x / 2, size.y / 2 );
10055 
10056                 position = position.plus( overlayCenter ).rotate(
10057                     degrees,
10058                     drawerCenter
10059                 ).minus( overlayCenter );
10060 
10061                 size = size.rotate( degrees, new $.Point( 0, 0 ) );
10062                 size = new $.Point( Math.abs( size.x ), Math.abs( size.y ) );
10063             }
10064 
10065             // call the onDraw callback if there is one to allow, this allows someone to overwrite
10066             // the drawing/positioning/sizing of the overlay
10067             if (this.onDraw) {
10068                 this.onDraw(position, size, element);
10069             } else {
10070                 style.left     = position.x + "px";
10071                 style.top      = position.y + "px";
10072                 style.position = "absolute";
10073                 style.display  = 'block';
10074 
10075                 if ( scales ) {
10076                     style.width  = size.x + "px";
10077                     style.height = size.y + "px";
10078                 }
10079             }
10080         },
10081 
10082         /**
10083          * @function
10084          * @param {OpenSeadragon.Point|OpenSeadragon.Rect} location
10085          * @param {OpenSeadragon.OverlayPlacement} position
10086          */
10087         update: function( location, placement ) {
10088             this.scales     = location instanceof $.Rect;
10089             this.bounds     = new $.Rect(
10090                 location.x,
10091                 location.y,
10092                 location.width,
10093                 location.height
10094             );
10095             // rects are always top-left
10096             this.placement  = location instanceof $.Point ?
10097                 placement :
10098                 $.OverlayPlacement.TOP_LEFT;
10099         }
10100 
10101     };
10102 
10103 }( OpenSeadragon ));
10104 
10105 /*
10106  * OpenSeadragon - Drawer
10107  *
10108  * Copyright (C) 2009 CodePlex Foundation
10109  * Copyright (C) 2010-2013 OpenSeadragon contributors
10110  *
10111  * Redistribution and use in source and binary forms, with or without
10112  * modification, are permitted provided that the following conditions are
10113  * met:
10114  *
10115  * - Redistributions of source code must retain the above copyright notice,
10116  *   this list of conditions and the following disclaimer.
10117  *
10118  * - Redistributions in binary form must reproduce the above copyright
10119  *   notice, this list of conditions and the following disclaimer in the
10120  *   documentation and/or other materials provided with the distribution.
10121  *
10122  * - Neither the name of CodePlex Foundation nor the names of its
10123  *   contributors may be used to endorse or promote products derived from
10124  *   this software without specific prior written permission.
10125  *
10126  * THIS SOFTWARE IS PROVIDED BY THE COPYRIGHT HOLDERS AND CONTRIBUTORS
10127  * "AS IS" AND ANY EXPRESS OR IMPLIED WARRANTIES, INCLUDING, BUT NOT
10128  * LIMITED TO, THE IMPLIED WARRANTIES OF MERCHANTABILITY AND FITNESS FOR
10129  * A PARTICULAR PURPOSE ARE DISCLAIMED.  IN NO EVENT SHALL THE COPYRIGHT
10130  * OWNER OR CONTRIBUTORS BE LIABLE FOR ANY DIRECT, INDIRECT, INCIDENTAL,
10131  * SPECIAL, EXEMPLARY, OR CONSEQUENTIAL DAMAGES (INCLUDING, BUT NOT LIMITED
10132  * TO, PROCUREMENT OF SUBSTITUTE GOODS OR SERVICES; LOSS OF USE, DATA, OR
10133  * PROFITS; OR BUSINESS INTERRUPTION) HOWEVER CAUSED AND ON ANY THEORY OF
10134  * LIABILITY, WHETHER IN CONTRACT, STRICT LIABILITY, OR TORT (INCLUDING
10135  * NEGLIGENCE OR OTHERWISE) ARISING IN ANY WAY OUT OF THE USE OF THIS
10136  * SOFTWARE, EVEN IF ADVISED OF THE POSSIBILITY OF SUCH DAMAGE.
10137  */
10138 
10139 (function( $ ){
10140 
10141 var DEVICE_SCREEN       = $.getWindowSize(),
10142     BROWSER             = $.Browser.vendor,
10143     BROWSER_VERSION     = $.Browser.version,
10144 
10145     SUBPIXEL_RENDERING = (
10146         ( BROWSER == $.BROWSERS.FIREFOX ) ||
10147         ( BROWSER == $.BROWSERS.OPERA )   ||
10148         ( BROWSER == $.BROWSERS.SAFARI && BROWSER_VERSION >= 4 ) ||
10149         ( BROWSER == $.BROWSERS.CHROME && BROWSER_VERSION >= 2 ) ||
10150         ( BROWSER == $.BROWSERS.IE     && BROWSER_VERSION >= 9 )
10151     ),
10152 
10153     USE_CANVAS = SUBPIXEL_RENDERING &&
10154         !( DEVICE_SCREEN.x <= 400 || DEVICE_SCREEN.y <= 400 ) &&
10155         !( navigator.appVersion.match( 'Mobile' ) ) &&
10156         $.isFunction( document.createElement( "canvas" ).getContext );
10157 
10158 //console.error( 'USE_CANVAS ' + USE_CANVAS );
10159 
10160 /**
10161  * @class
10162  * @param {OpenSeadragon.TileSource} source - Reference to Viewer tile source.
10163  * @param {OpenSeadragon.Viewport} viewport - Reference to Viewer viewport.
10164  * @param {Element} element - Reference to Viewer 'canvas'.
10165  * @property {OpenSeadragon.TileSource} source - Reference to Viewer tile source.
10166  * @property {OpenSeadragon.Viewport} viewport - Reference to Viewer viewport.
10167  * @property {Element} container - Reference to Viewer 'canvas'.
10168  * @property {Element|Canvas} canvas - TODO
10169  * @property {CanvasContext} context - TODO
10170  * @property {Object} config - Reference to Viewer config.
10171  * @property {Number} downloading - How many images are currently being loaded in parallel.
10172  * @property {Number} normHeight - Ratio of zoomable image height to width.
10173  * @property {Object} tilesMatrix - A '3d' dictionary [level][x][y] --> Tile.
10174  * @property {Array} tilesLoaded - An unordered list of Tiles with loaded images.
10175  * @property {Object} coverage - A '3d' dictionary [level][x][y] --> Boolean.
10176  * @property {Array} overlays - An unordered list of Overlays added.
10177  * @property {Array} lastDrawn - An unordered list of Tiles drawn last frame.
10178  * @property {Number} lastResetTime - Last time for which the drawer was reset.
10179  * @property {Boolean} midUpdate - Is the drawer currently updating the viewport?
10180  * @property {Boolean} updateAgain - Does the drawer need to update the viewort again?
10181  * @property {Element} element - DEPRECATED Alias for container.
10182  */
10183 $.Drawer = function( options ) {
10184 
10185     //backward compatibility for positional args while prefering more
10186     //idiomatic javascript options object as the only argument
10187     var args  = arguments,
10188         i;
10189 
10190     if( !$.isPlainObject( options ) ){
10191         options = {
10192             source:     args[ 0 ],
10193             viewport:   args[ 1 ],
10194             element:    args[ 2 ]
10195         };
10196     }
10197 
10198     $.extend( true, this, {
10199 
10200         //internal state properties
10201         viewer:         null,
10202         downloading:    0,
10203         tilesMatrix:    {},
10204         tilesLoaded:    [],
10205         coverage:       {},
10206         lastDrawn:      [],
10207         lastResetTime:  0,
10208         midUpdate:      false,
10209         updateAgain:    true,
10210 
10211 
10212         //internal state / configurable settings
10213         overlays:           [],
10214         collectionOverlays: {},
10215 
10216         //configurable settings
10217         maxImageCacheCount: $.DEFAULT_SETTINGS.maxImageCacheCount,
10218         imageLoaderLimit:   $.DEFAULT_SETTINGS.imageLoaderLimit,
10219         minZoomImageRatio:  $.DEFAULT_SETTINGS.minZoomImageRatio,
10220         wrapHorizontal:     $.DEFAULT_SETTINGS.wrapHorizontal,
10221         wrapVertical:       $.DEFAULT_SETTINGS.wrapVertical,
10222         immediateRender:    $.DEFAULT_SETTINGS.immediateRender,
10223         blendTime:          $.DEFAULT_SETTINGS.blendTime,
10224         alwaysBlend:        $.DEFAULT_SETTINGS.alwaysBlend,
10225         minPixelRatio:      $.DEFAULT_SETTINGS.minPixelRatio,
10226         debugMode:          $.DEFAULT_SETTINGS.debugMode,
10227         timeout:            $.DEFAULT_SETTINGS.timeout
10228 
10229     }, options );
10230 
10231     this.container  = $.getElement( this.element );
10232     this.canvas     = $.makeNeutralElement( USE_CANVAS ? "canvas" : "div" );
10233     this.context    = USE_CANVAS ? this.canvas.getContext( "2d" ) : null;
10234     this.normHeight = this.source.dimensions.y / this.source.dimensions.x;
10235     this.element    = this.container;
10236 
10237     // We force our container to ltr because our drawing math doesn't work in rtl.
10238     // This issue only affects our canvas renderer, but we do it always for consistency.
10239     // Note that this means overlays you want to be rtl need to be explicitly set to rtl.
10240     this.container.dir = 'ltr';
10241 
10242     this.canvas.style.width     = "100%";
10243     this.canvas.style.height    = "100%";
10244     this.canvas.style.position  = "absolute";
10245 
10246     // explicit left-align
10247     this.container.style.textAlign = "left";
10248     this.container.appendChild( this.canvas );
10249 
10250     //create the correct type of overlay by convention if the overlays
10251     //are not already OpenSeadragon.Overlays
10252     for( i = 0; i < this.overlays.length; i++ ){
10253         if( $.isPlainObject( this.overlays[ i ] ) ){
10254 
10255             this.overlays[ i ] = addOverlayFromConfiguration( this, this.overlays[ i ]);
10256 
10257         } else if ( $.isFunction( this.overlays[ i ] ) ){
10258             //TODO
10259         }
10260     }
10261 
10262     //this.profiler    = new $.Profiler();
10263 };
10264 
10265 $.Drawer.prototype = {
10266 
10267     /**
10268      * Adds an html element as an overlay to the current viewport.  Useful for
10269      * highlighting words or areas of interest on an image or other zoomable
10270      * interface.
10271      * @method
10272      * @param {Element|String|Object} element - A reference to an element or an id for
10273      *      the element which will overlayed. Or an Object specifying the configuration for the overlay
10274      * @param {OpenSeadragon.Point|OpenSeadragon.Rect} location - The point or
10275      *      rectangle which will be overlayed.
10276      * @param {OpenSeadragon.OverlayPlacement} placement - The position of the
10277      *      viewport which the location coordinates will be treated as relative
10278      *      to.
10279      * @param {function} onDraw - If supplied the callback is called when the overlay 
10280      *      needs to be drawn. It it the responsibility of the callback to do any drawing/positioning.
10281      *      It is passed position, size and element.
10282      */
10283     addOverlay: function( element, location, placement, onDraw ) {
10284         var options;
10285         if( $.isPlainObject( element ) ){
10286             options = element;
10287         } else {
10288             options = {
10289                 element: element,
10290                 location: location,
10291                 placement: placement,
10292                 onDraw: onDraw
10293             };
10294         }
10295 
10296         element = $.getElement(options.element);
10297 
10298         if ( getOverlayIndex( this.overlays, element ) >= 0 ) {
10299             // they're trying to add a duplicate overlay
10300             return;
10301         }
10302 
10303         this.overlays.push( new $.Overlay({
10304             element: element,
10305             location: options.location,
10306             placement: options.placement,
10307             onDraw: options.onDraw
10308         }) );
10309         this.updateAgain = true;
10310         if( this.viewer ){
10311             this.viewer.raiseEvent( 'add-overlay', {
10312                 viewer: this.viewer,
10313                 element: element,
10314                 location: options.location,
10315                 placement: options.placement
10316             });
10317         }
10318         return this;
10319     },
10320 
10321     /**
10322      * Updates the overlay represented by the reference to the element or
10323      * element id moving it to the new location, relative to the new placement.
10324      * @method
10325      * @param {OpenSeadragon.Point|OpenSeadragon.Rect} location - The point or
10326      *      rectangle which will be overlayed.
10327      * @param {OpenSeadragon.OverlayPlacement} placement - The position of the
10328      *      viewport which the location coordinates will be treated as relative
10329      *      to.
10330      * @return {OpenSeadragon.Drawer} Chainable.
10331      */
10332     updateOverlay: function( element, location, placement ) {
10333         var i;
10334 
10335         element = $.getElement( element );
10336         i = getOverlayIndex( this.overlays, element );
10337 
10338         if ( i >= 0 ) {
10339             this.overlays[ i ].update( location, placement );
10340             this.updateAgain = true;
10341         }
10342         if( this.viewer ){
10343             this.viewer.raiseEvent( 'update-overlay', {
10344                 viewer: this.viewer,
10345                 element: element,
10346                 location: location,
10347                 placement: placement
10348             });
10349         }
10350         return this;
10351     },
10352 
10353     /**
10354      * Removes and overlay identified by the reference element or element id
10355      *      and schedules and update.
10356      * @method
10357      * @param {Element|String} element - A reference to the element or an
10358      *      element id which represent the ovelay content to be removed.
10359      * @return {OpenSeadragon.Drawer} Chainable.
10360      */
10361     removeOverlay: function( element ) {
10362         var i;
10363 
10364         element = $.getElement( element );
10365         i = getOverlayIndex( this.overlays, element );
10366 
10367         if ( i >= 0 ) {
10368             this.overlays[ i ].destroy();
10369             this.overlays.splice( i, 1 );
10370             this.updateAgain = true;
10371         }
10372         if( this.viewer ){
10373             this.viewer.raiseEvent( 'remove-overlay', {
10374                 viewer: this.viewer,
10375                 element: element
10376             });
10377         }
10378         return this;
10379     },
10380 
10381     /**
10382      * Removes all currently configured Overlays from this Drawer and schedules
10383      *      and update.
10384      * @method
10385      * @return {OpenSeadragon.Drawer} Chainable.
10386      */
10387     clearOverlays: function() {
10388         while ( this.overlays.length > 0 ) {
10389             this.overlays.pop().destroy();
10390             this.updateAgain = true;
10391         }
10392         if( this.viewer ){
10393             this.viewer.raiseEvent( 'clear-overlay', {
10394                 viewer: this.viewer
10395             });
10396         }
10397         return this;
10398     },
10399 
10400 
10401     /**
10402      * Returns whether the Drawer is scheduled for an update at the
10403      *      soonest possible opportunity.
10404      * @method
10405      * @returns {Boolean} - Whether the Drawer is scheduled for an update at the
10406      *      soonest possible opportunity.
10407      */
10408     needsUpdate: function() {
10409         return this.updateAgain;
10410     },
10411 
10412     /**
10413      * Returns the total number of tiles that have been loaded by this Drawer.
10414      * @method
10415      * @returns {Number} - The total number of tiles that have been loaded by
10416      *      this Drawer.
10417      */
10418     numTilesLoaded: function() {
10419         return this.tilesLoaded.length;
10420     },
10421 
10422     /**
10423      * Clears all tiles and triggers an update on the next call to
10424      * Drawer.prototype.update().
10425      * @method
10426      * @return {OpenSeadragon.Drawer} Chainable.
10427      */
10428     reset: function() {
10429         clearTiles( this );
10430         this.lastResetTime = $.now();
10431         this.updateAgain = true;
10432         return this;
10433     },
10434 
10435     /**
10436      * Forces the Drawer to update.
10437      * @method
10438      * @return {OpenSeadragon.Drawer} Chainable.
10439      */
10440     update: function() {
10441         //this.profiler.beginUpdate();
10442         this.midUpdate = true;
10443         updateViewport( this );
10444         this.midUpdate = false;
10445         //this.profiler.endUpdate();
10446         return this;
10447     },
10448 
10449     /**
10450      * Used internally to load images when required.  May also be used to
10451      * preload a set of images so the browser will have them available in
10452      * the local cache to optimize user experience in certain cases. Because
10453      * the number of parallel image loads is configurable, if too many images
10454      * are currently being loaded, the request will be ignored.  Since by
10455      * default drawer.imageLoaderLimit is 0, the native browser parallel
10456      * image loading policy will be used.
10457      * @method
10458      * @param {String} src - The url of the image to load.
10459      * @param {Function} callback - The function that will be called with the
10460      *      Image object as the only parameter if it was loaded successfully.
10461      *      If an error occured, or the request timed out or was aborted,
10462      *      the parameter is null instead.
10463      * @return {Boolean} loading - Whether the request was submitted or ignored
10464      *      based on OpenSeadragon.DEFAULT_SETTINGS.imageLoaderLimit.
10465      */
10466     loadImage: function( src, callback ) {
10467         var _this = this,
10468             loading = false,
10469             image,
10470             jobid,
10471             complete;
10472 
10473         if ( !this.imageLoaderLimit ||
10474               this.downloading < this.imageLoaderLimit ) {
10475 
10476             this.downloading++;
10477 
10478             image = new Image();
10479 
10480             complete = function( imagesrc, resultingImage ){
10481                 _this.downloading--;
10482                 if (typeof ( callback ) == "function") {
10483                     try {
10484                         callback( resultingImage );
10485                     } catch ( e ) {
10486                         $.console.error(
10487                             "%s while executing %s callback: %s",
10488                             e.name,
10489                             src,
10490                             e.message,
10491                             e
10492                         );
10493                     }
10494                 }
10495             };
10496 
10497             image.onload = function(){
10498                 finishLoadingImage( image, complete, true, jobid );
10499             };
10500 
10501             image.onabort = image.onerror = function(){
10502                 finishLoadingImage( image, complete, false, jobid );
10503             };
10504 
10505             jobid = window.setTimeout( function(){
10506                 finishLoadingImage( image, complete, false, jobid );
10507             }, this.timeout );
10508 
10509             loading   = true;
10510             image.src = src;
10511         }
10512 
10513         return loading;
10514     },
10515 
10516     canRotate: function() {
10517         return USE_CANVAS;
10518     }
10519 };
10520 
10521 /**
10522  * @private
10523  * @inner
10524  */
10525  function addOverlayFromConfiguration( drawer, overlay ){
10526 
10527     var element  = null,
10528         rect = ( overlay.height && overlay.width ) ? new $.Rect(
10529             overlay.x || overlay.px,
10530             overlay.y || overlay.py,
10531             overlay.width,
10532             overlay.height
10533         ) : new $.Point(
10534             overlay.x || overlay.px,
10535             overlay.y || overlay.py
10536         ),
10537         id = overlay.id ?
10538             overlay.id :
10539             "openseadragon-overlay-"+Math.floor(Math.random()*10000000);
10540 
10541     element = $.getElement(overlay.id);
10542     if( !element ){
10543         element         = document.createElement("a");
10544         element.href    = "#/overlay/"+id;
10545     }
10546     element.id        = id;
10547     $.addClass( element, overlay.className ?
10548         overlay.className :
10549         "openseadragon-overlay"
10550     );
10551 
10552 
10553     if(overlay.px !== undefined){
10554         //if they specified 'px' so it's in pixel coordinates so
10555         //we need to translate to viewport coordinates
10556         rect = drawer.viewport.imageToViewportRectangle( rect );
10557     }
10558     
10559     if( overlay.placement ){
10560         return new $.Overlay({
10561             element: element,
10562             location: drawer.viewport.pointFromPixel(rect),
10563             placement: $.OverlayPlacement[overlay.placement.toUpperCase()],
10564             onDraw: overlay.onDraw
10565         });
10566     }else{
10567         return new $.Overlay({
10568             element: element,
10569             location: rect,
10570             onDraw: overlay.onDraw
10571         });
10572     }
10573 
10574 }
10575 
10576 /**
10577  * @private
10578  * @inner
10579  * Pretty much every other line in this needs to be documented so it's clear
10580  * how each piece of this routine contributes to the drawing process.  That's
10581  * why there are so many TODO's inside this function.
10582  */
10583 function updateViewport( drawer ) {
10584 
10585     drawer.updateAgain = false;
10586 
10587     if( drawer.viewer ){
10588         drawer.viewer.raiseEvent( 'update-viewport', {
10589             viewer: drawer.viewer
10590         });
10591     }
10592 
10593     var tile,
10594         level,
10595         best            = null,
10596         haveDrawn       = false,
10597         currentTime     = $.now(),
10598         viewportSize    = drawer.viewport.getContainerSize(),
10599         viewportBounds  = drawer.viewport.getBounds( true ),
10600         viewportTL      = viewportBounds.getTopLeft(),
10601         viewportBR      = viewportBounds.getBottomRight(),
10602         zeroRatioC      = drawer.viewport.deltaPixelsFromPoints(
10603             drawer.source.getPixelRatio( 0 ),
10604             true
10605         ).x,
10606         lowestLevel     = Math.max(
10607             drawer.source.minLevel,
10608             Math.floor(
10609                 Math.log( drawer.minZoomImageRatio ) /
10610                 Math.log( 2 )
10611             )
10612         ),
10613         highestLevel    = Math.min(
10614             Math.abs(drawer.source.maxLevel),
10615             Math.abs(Math.floor(
10616                 Math.log( zeroRatioC / drawer.minPixelRatio ) /
10617                 Math.log( 2 )
10618             ))
10619         ),
10620         degrees         = drawer.viewport.degrees,
10621         renderPixelRatioC,
10622         renderPixelRatioT,
10623         zeroRatioT,
10624         optimalRatio,
10625         levelOpacity,
10626         levelVisibility;
10627 
10628     //TODO
10629     while ( drawer.lastDrawn.length > 0 ) {
10630         tile = drawer.lastDrawn.pop();
10631         tile.beingDrawn = false;
10632     }
10633 
10634     //TODO
10635     drawer.canvas.innerHTML   = "";
10636     if ( USE_CANVAS ) {
10637         if( drawer.canvas.width  != viewportSize.x ||
10638             drawer.canvas.height != viewportSize.y ){
10639             drawer.canvas.width  = viewportSize.x;
10640             drawer.canvas.height = viewportSize.y;
10641         }
10642         drawer.context.clearRect( 0, 0, viewportSize.x, viewportSize.y );
10643     }
10644 
10645     //Change bounds for rotation
10646     if (degrees === 90 || degrees === 270) {
10647         var rotatedBounds = viewportBounds.rotate( degrees );
10648         viewportTL = rotatedBounds.getTopLeft();
10649         viewportBR = rotatedBounds.getBottomRight();
10650     }
10651 
10652     //Don't draw if completely outside of the viewport
10653     if  ( !drawer.wrapHorizontal &&
10654         ( viewportBR.x < 0 || viewportTL.x > 1 ) ) {
10655         return;
10656     } else if
10657         ( !drawer.wrapVertical &&
10658         ( viewportBR.y < 0 || viewportTL.y > drawer.normHeight ) ) {
10659         return;
10660     }
10661 
10662     //TODO
10663     if ( !drawer.wrapHorizontal ) {
10664         viewportTL.x = Math.max( viewportTL.x, 0 );
10665         viewportBR.x = Math.min( viewportBR.x, 1 );
10666     }
10667     if ( !drawer.wrapVertical ) {
10668         viewportTL.y = Math.max( viewportTL.y, 0 );
10669         viewportBR.y = Math.min( viewportBR.y, drawer.normHeight );
10670     }
10671 
10672     //TODO
10673     lowestLevel = Math.min( lowestLevel, highestLevel );
10674 
10675     //TODO
10676     var drawLevel; // FIXME: drawLevel should have a more explanatory name
10677     for ( level = highestLevel; level >= lowestLevel; level-- ) {
10678         drawLevel = false;
10679 
10680         //Avoid calculations for draw if we have already drawn this
10681         renderPixelRatioC = drawer.viewport.deltaPixelsFromPoints(
10682             drawer.source.getPixelRatio( level ),
10683             true
10684         ).x;
10685 
10686         if ( ( !haveDrawn && renderPixelRatioC >= drawer.minPixelRatio ) ||
10687              ( level == lowestLevel ) ) {
10688             drawLevel = true;
10689             haveDrawn = true;
10690         } else if ( !haveDrawn ) {
10691             continue;
10692         }
10693 
10694         //Perform calculations for draw if we haven't drawn this
10695         renderPixelRatioT = drawer.viewport.deltaPixelsFromPoints(
10696             drawer.source.getPixelRatio( level ),
10697             false
10698         ).x;
10699 
10700         zeroRatioT      = drawer.viewport.deltaPixelsFromPoints(
10701             drawer.source.getPixelRatio(
10702                 Math.max(
10703                     drawer.source.getClosestLevel( drawer.viewport.containerSize ) - 1,
10704                     0
10705                 )
10706             ),
10707             false
10708         ).x;
10709 
10710         optimalRatio    = drawer.immediateRender ?
10711             1 :
10712             zeroRatioT;
10713 
10714         levelOpacity    = Math.min( 1, ( renderPixelRatioC - 0.5 ) / 0.5 );
10715 
10716         levelVisibility = optimalRatio / Math.abs(
10717             optimalRatio - renderPixelRatioT
10718         );
10719 
10720         //TODO
10721         best = updateLevel(
10722             drawer,
10723             haveDrawn,
10724             drawLevel,
10725             level,
10726             levelOpacity,
10727             levelVisibility,
10728             viewportTL,
10729             viewportBR,
10730             currentTime,
10731             best
10732         );
10733 
10734         //TODO
10735         if (  providesCoverage( drawer.coverage, level ) ) {
10736             break;
10737         }
10738     }
10739 
10740     //TODO
10741     drawTiles( drawer, drawer.lastDrawn );
10742     drawOverlays( drawer.viewport, drawer.overlays, drawer.container );
10743 
10744     //TODO
10745     if ( best ) {
10746         loadTile( drawer, best, currentTime );
10747         // because we haven't finished drawing, so
10748         drawer.updateAgain = true;
10749     }
10750 
10751 }
10752 
10753 
10754 function updateLevel( drawer, haveDrawn, drawLevel, level, levelOpacity, levelVisibility, viewportTL, viewportBR, currentTime, best ){
10755 
10756     var x, y,
10757         tileTL,
10758         tileBR,
10759         numberOfTiles,
10760         viewportCenter  = drawer.viewport.pixelFromPoint( drawer.viewport.getCenter() );
10761 
10762 
10763     if( drawer.viewer ){
10764         drawer.viewer.raiseEvent( 'update-level', {
10765             viewer: drawer.viewer,
10766             havedrawn: haveDrawn,
10767             level: level,
10768             opacity: levelOpacity,
10769             visibility: levelVisibility,
10770             topleft: viewportTL,
10771             bottomright: viewportBR,
10772             currenttime: currentTime,
10773             best: best
10774         });
10775     }
10776 
10777     //OK, a new drawing so do your calculations
10778     tileTL    = drawer.source.getTileAtPoint( level, viewportTL );
10779     tileBR    = drawer.source.getTileAtPoint( level, viewportBR );
10780     numberOfTiles  = drawer.source.getNumTiles( level );
10781 
10782     resetCoverage( drawer.coverage, level );
10783 
10784     if ( !drawer.wrapHorizontal ) {
10785         tileBR.x = Math.min( tileBR.x, numberOfTiles.x - 1 );
10786     }
10787     if ( !drawer.wrapVertical ) {
10788         tileBR.y = Math.min( tileBR.y, numberOfTiles.y - 1 );
10789     }
10790 
10791     for ( x = tileTL.x; x <= tileBR.x; x++ ) {
10792         for ( y = tileTL.y; y <= tileBR.y; y++ ) {
10793 
10794             best = updateTile(
10795                 drawer,
10796                 drawLevel,
10797                 haveDrawn,
10798                 x, y,
10799                 level,
10800                 levelOpacity,
10801                 levelVisibility,
10802                 viewportCenter,
10803                 numberOfTiles,
10804                 currentTime,
10805                 best
10806             );
10807 
10808         }
10809     }
10810 
10811     return best;
10812 }
10813 
10814 function updateTile( drawer, drawLevel, haveDrawn, x, y, level, levelOpacity, levelVisibility, viewportCenter, numberOfTiles, currentTime, best){
10815 
10816     var tile = getTile(
10817             x, y,
10818             level,
10819             drawer.source,
10820             drawer.tilesMatrix,
10821             currentTime,
10822             numberOfTiles,
10823             drawer.normHeight
10824         ),
10825         drawTile = drawLevel;
10826 
10827     if( drawer.viewer ){
10828         drawer.viewer.raiseEvent( 'update-tile', {
10829             viewer: drawer.viewer,
10830             tile: tile
10831         });
10832     }
10833 
10834     setCoverage( drawer.coverage, level, x, y, false );
10835 
10836     if ( !tile.exists ) {
10837         return best;
10838     }
10839 
10840     if ( haveDrawn && !drawTile ) {
10841         if ( isCovered( drawer.coverage, level, x, y ) ) {
10842             setCoverage( drawer.coverage, level, x, y, true );
10843         } else {
10844             drawTile = true;
10845         }
10846     }
10847 
10848     if ( !drawTile ) {
10849         return best;
10850     }
10851 
10852     positionTile(
10853         tile,
10854         drawer.source.tileOverlap,
10855         drawer.viewport,
10856         viewportCenter,
10857         levelVisibility
10858     );
10859 
10860     if ( tile.loaded ) {
10861         var needsUpdate = blendTile(
10862             drawer,
10863             tile,
10864             x, y,
10865             level,
10866             levelOpacity,
10867             currentTime
10868         );
10869 
10870         if ( needsUpdate ) {
10871             drawer.updateAgain = true;
10872         }
10873     } else if ( tile.loading ) {
10874         // the tile is already in the download queue
10875         // thanks josh1093 for finally translating this typo
10876     } else {
10877         best = compareTiles( best, tile );
10878     }
10879 
10880     return best;
10881 }
10882 
10883 function getTile( x, y, level, tileSource, tilesMatrix, time, numTiles, normHeight ) {
10884     var xMod,
10885         yMod,
10886         bounds,
10887         exists,
10888         url,
10889         tile;
10890 
10891     if ( !tilesMatrix[ level ] ) {
10892         tilesMatrix[ level ] = {};
10893     }
10894     if ( !tilesMatrix[ level ][ x ] ) {
10895         tilesMatrix[ level ][ x ] = {};
10896     }
10897 
10898     if ( !tilesMatrix[ level ][ x ][ y ] ) {
10899         xMod    = ( numTiles.x + ( x % numTiles.x ) ) % numTiles.x;
10900         yMod    = ( numTiles.y + ( y % numTiles.y ) ) % numTiles.y;
10901         bounds  = tileSource.getTileBounds( level, xMod, yMod );
10902         exists  = tileSource.tileExists( level, xMod, yMod );
10903         url     = tileSource.getTileUrl( level, xMod, yMod );
10904 
10905         bounds.x += 1.0 * ( x - xMod ) / numTiles.x;
10906         bounds.y += normHeight * ( y - yMod ) / numTiles.y;
10907 
10908         tilesMatrix[ level ][ x ][ y ] = new $.Tile(
10909             level,
10910             x,
10911             y,
10912             bounds,
10913             exists,
10914             url
10915         );
10916     }
10917 
10918     tile = tilesMatrix[ level ][ x ][ y ];
10919     tile.lastTouchTime = time;
10920 
10921     return tile;
10922 }
10923 
10924 
10925 function loadTile( drawer, tile, time ) {
10926     if( drawer.viewport.collectionMode ){
10927         drawer.midUpdate = false;
10928         onTileLoad( drawer, tile, time );
10929     } else {
10930         tile.loading = drawer.loadImage(
10931             tile.url,
10932             function( image ){
10933                 onTileLoad( drawer, tile, time, image );
10934             }
10935         );
10936     }
10937 }
10938 
10939 function onTileLoad( drawer, tile, time, image ) {
10940     var insertionIndex,
10941         cutoff,
10942         worstTile,
10943         worstTime,
10944         worstLevel,
10945         worstTileIndex,
10946         prevTile,
10947         prevTime,
10948         prevLevel,
10949         i;
10950 
10951     tile.loading = false;
10952 
10953     if ( drawer.midUpdate ) {
10954         $.console.warn( "Tile load callback in middle of drawing routine." );
10955         return;
10956     } else if ( !image  && !drawer.viewport.collectionMode ) {
10957         $.console.log( "Tile %s failed to load: %s", tile, tile.url );
10958         if( !drawer.debugMode ){
10959             tile.exists = false;
10960             return;
10961         }
10962     } else if ( time < drawer.lastResetTime ) {
10963         $.console.log( "Ignoring tile %s loaded before reset: %s", tile, tile.url );
10964         return;
10965     }
10966 
10967     tile.loaded = true;
10968     tile.image  = image;
10969 
10970 
10971     insertionIndex = drawer.tilesLoaded.length;
10972 
10973     if ( drawer.tilesLoaded.length >= drawer.maxImageCacheCount ) {
10974         cutoff = Math.ceil( Math.log( drawer.source.tileSize ) / Math.log( 2 ) );
10975 
10976         worstTile       = null;
10977         worstTileIndex  = -1;
10978 
10979         for ( i = drawer.tilesLoaded.length - 1; i >= 0; i-- ) {
10980             prevTile = drawer.tilesLoaded[ i ];
10981 
10982             if ( prevTile.level <= drawer.cutoff || prevTile.beingDrawn ) {
10983                 continue;
10984             } else if ( !worstTile ) {
10985                 worstTile       = prevTile;
10986                 worstTileIndex  = i;
10987                 continue;
10988             }
10989 
10990             prevTime    = prevTile.lastTouchTime;
10991             worstTime   = worstTile.lastTouchTime;
10992             prevLevel   = prevTile.level;
10993             worstLevel  = worstTile.level;
10994 
10995             if ( prevTime < worstTime ||
10996                ( prevTime == worstTime && prevLevel > worstLevel ) ) {
10997                 worstTile       = prevTile;
10998                 worstTileIndex  = i;
10999             }
11000         }
11001 
11002         if ( worstTile && worstTileIndex >= 0 ) {
11003             worstTile.unload();
11004             insertionIndex = worstTileIndex;
11005         }
11006     }
11007 
11008     drawer.tilesLoaded[ insertionIndex ] = tile;
11009     drawer.updateAgain = true;
11010 }
11011 
11012 
11013 function positionTile( tile, overlap, viewport, viewportCenter, levelVisibility ){
11014     var boundsTL     = tile.bounds.getTopLeft(),
11015         boundsSize   = tile.bounds.getSize(),
11016         positionC    = viewport.pixelFromPoint( boundsTL, true ),
11017         positionT    = viewport.pixelFromPoint( boundsTL, false ),
11018         sizeC        = viewport.deltaPixelsFromPoints( boundsSize, true ),
11019         sizeT        = viewport.deltaPixelsFromPoints( boundsSize, false ),
11020         tileCenter   = positionT.plus( sizeT.divide( 2 ) ),
11021         tileDistance = viewportCenter.distanceTo( tileCenter );
11022 
11023     if ( !overlap ) {
11024         sizeC = sizeC.plus( new $.Point( 1, 1 ) );
11025     }
11026 
11027     tile.position   = positionC;
11028     tile.size       = sizeC;
11029     tile.distance   = tileDistance;
11030     tile.visibility = levelVisibility;
11031 }
11032 
11033 
11034 function blendTile( drawer, tile, x, y, level, levelOpacity, currentTime ){
11035     var blendTimeMillis = 1000 * drawer.blendTime,
11036         deltaTime,
11037         opacity;
11038 
11039     if ( !tile.blendStart ) {
11040         tile.blendStart = currentTime;
11041     }
11042 
11043     deltaTime   = currentTime - tile.blendStart;
11044     opacity     = blendTimeMillis ? Math.min( 1, deltaTime / ( blendTimeMillis ) ) : 1;
11045 
11046     if ( drawer.alwaysBlend ) {
11047         opacity *= levelOpacity;
11048     }
11049 
11050     tile.opacity = opacity;
11051 
11052     drawer.lastDrawn.push( tile );
11053 
11054     if ( opacity == 1 ) {
11055         setCoverage( drawer.coverage, level, x, y, true );
11056     } else if ( deltaTime < blendTimeMillis ) {
11057         return true;
11058     }
11059 
11060     return false;
11061 }
11062 
11063 
11064 function clearTiles( drawer ) {
11065     drawer.tilesMatrix = {};
11066     drawer.tilesLoaded = [];
11067 }
11068 
11069 /**
11070  * @private
11071  * @inner
11072  * Returns true if the given tile provides coverage to lower-level tiles of
11073  * lower resolution representing the same content. If neither x nor y is
11074  * given, returns true if the entire visible level provides coverage.
11075  *
11076  * Note that out-of-bounds tiles provide coverage in this sense, since
11077  * there's no content that they would need to cover. Tiles at non-existent
11078  * levels that are within the image bounds, however, do not.
11079  */
11080 function providesCoverage( coverage, level, x, y ) {
11081     var rows,
11082         cols,
11083         i, j;
11084 
11085     if ( !coverage[ level ] ) {
11086         return false;
11087     }
11088 
11089     if ( x === undefined || y === undefined ) {
11090         rows = coverage[ level ];
11091         for ( i in rows ) {
11092             if ( rows.hasOwnProperty( i ) ) {
11093                 cols = rows[ i ];
11094                 for ( j in cols ) {
11095                     if ( cols.hasOwnProperty( j ) && !cols[ j ] ) {
11096                         return false;
11097                     }
11098                 }
11099             }
11100         }
11101 
11102         return true;
11103     }
11104 
11105     return (
11106         coverage[ level ][ x] === undefined ||
11107         coverage[ level ][ x ][ y ] === undefined ||
11108         coverage[ level ][ x ][ y ] === true
11109     );
11110 }
11111 
11112 /**
11113  * @private
11114  * @inner
11115  * Returns true if the given tile is completely covered by higher-level
11116  * tiles of higher resolution representing the same content. If neither x
11117  * nor y is given, returns true if the entire visible level is covered.
11118  */
11119 function isCovered( coverage, level, x, y ) {
11120     if ( x === undefined || y === undefined ) {
11121         return providesCoverage( coverage, level + 1 );
11122     } else {
11123         return (
11124              providesCoverage( coverage, level + 1, 2 * x, 2 * y ) &&
11125              providesCoverage( coverage, level + 1, 2 * x, 2 * y + 1 ) &&
11126              providesCoverage( coverage, level + 1, 2 * x + 1, 2 * y ) &&
11127              providesCoverage( coverage, level + 1, 2 * x + 1, 2 * y + 1 )
11128         );
11129     }
11130 }
11131 
11132 /**
11133  * @private
11134  * @inner
11135  * Sets whether the given tile provides coverage or not.
11136  */
11137 function setCoverage( coverage, level, x, y, covers ) {
11138     if ( !coverage[ level ] ) {
11139         $.console.warn(
11140             "Setting coverage for a tile before its level's coverage has been reset: %s",
11141             level
11142         );
11143         return;
11144     }
11145 
11146     if ( !coverage[ level ][ x ] ) {
11147         coverage[ level ][ x ] = {};
11148     }
11149 
11150     coverage[ level ][ x ][ y ] = covers;
11151 }
11152 
11153 /**
11154  * @private
11155  * @inner
11156  * Resets coverage information for the given level. This should be called
11157  * after every draw routine. Note that at the beginning of the next draw
11158  * routine, coverage for every visible tile should be explicitly set.
11159  */
11160 function resetCoverage( coverage, level ) {
11161     coverage[ level ] = {};
11162 }
11163 
11164 /**
11165  * @private
11166  * @inner
11167  * Determines the 'z-index' of the given overlay.  Overlays are ordered in
11168  * a z-index based on the order they are added to the Drawer.
11169  */
11170 function getOverlayIndex( overlays, element ) {
11171     var i;
11172     for ( i = overlays.length - 1; i >= 0; i-- ) {
11173         if ( overlays[ i ].element == element ) {
11174             return i;
11175         }
11176     }
11177 
11178     return -1;
11179 }
11180 
11181 /**
11182  * @private
11183  * @inner
11184  * Determines whether the 'last best' tile for the area is better than the
11185  * tile in question.
11186  */
11187 function compareTiles( previousBest, tile ) {
11188     if ( !previousBest ) {
11189         return tile;
11190     }
11191 
11192     if ( tile.visibility > previousBest.visibility ) {
11193         return tile;
11194     } else if ( tile.visibility == previousBest.visibility ) {
11195         if ( tile.distance < previousBest.distance ) {
11196             return tile;
11197         }
11198     }
11199 
11200     return previousBest;
11201 }
11202 
11203 function finishLoadingImage( image, callback, successful, jobid ){
11204 
11205     image.onload = null;
11206     image.onabort = null;
11207     image.onerror = null;
11208 
11209     if ( jobid ) {
11210         window.clearTimeout( jobid );
11211     }
11212     $.requestAnimationFrame( function() {
11213         callback( image.src, successful ? image : null);
11214     });
11215 
11216 }
11217 
11218 
11219 function drawOverlays( viewport, overlays, container ){
11220     var i,
11221         length = overlays.length;
11222     for ( i = 0; i < length; i++ ) {
11223         drawOverlay( viewport, overlays[ i ], container );
11224     }
11225 }
11226 
11227 function drawOverlay( viewport, overlay, container ){
11228 
11229     overlay.position = viewport.pixelFromPoint(
11230         overlay.bounds.getTopLeft(),
11231         true
11232     );
11233     overlay.size     = viewport.deltaPixelsFromPoints(
11234         overlay.bounds.getSize(),
11235         true
11236     );
11237     overlay.drawHTML( container, viewport );
11238 }
11239 
11240 function drawTiles( drawer, lastDrawn ){
11241     var i,
11242         tile,
11243         tileKey,
11244         viewer,
11245         viewport,
11246         position,
11247         tileSource,
11248         collectionTileSource;
11249 
11250     for ( i = lastDrawn.length - 1; i >= 0; i-- ) {
11251         tile = lastDrawn[ i ];
11252 
11253         //We dont actually 'draw' a collection tile, rather its used to house
11254         //an overlay which does the drawing in its own viewport
11255         if( drawer.viewport.collectionMode ){
11256 
11257             tileKey = tile.x + '/' + tile.y;
11258             viewport = drawer.viewport;
11259             collectionTileSource = viewport.collectionTileSource;
11260 
11261             if( !drawer.collectionOverlays[ tileKey ] ){
11262 
11263                 position = collectionTileSource.layout == 'horizontal' ?
11264                     tile.y + ( tile.x * collectionTileSource.rows ) :
11265                     tile.x + ( tile.y * collectionTileSource.rows );
11266 
11267                 if (position < collectionTileSource.tileSources.length) {
11268                     tileSource = collectionTileSource.tileSources[ position ];
11269                 } else {
11270                     tileSource = null;
11271                 }
11272 
11273                 //$.console.log("Rendering collection tile %s | %s | %s", tile.y, tile.y, position);
11274                 if( tileSource ){
11275                     drawer.collectionOverlays[ tileKey ] = viewer = new $.Viewer({
11276                         element:                $.makeNeutralElement( "div" ),
11277                         mouseNavEnabled:        false,
11278                         showNavigator:          false,
11279                         showSequenceControl:    false,
11280                         showNavigationControl:  false,
11281                         tileSources: [
11282                             tileSource
11283                         ]
11284                     });
11285 
11286                     //TODO: IE seems to barf on this, not sure if its just the border
11287                     //      but we probably need to clear this up with a better
11288                     //      test of support for various css features
11289                     if( SUBPIXEL_RENDERING ){
11290                         viewer.element.style.border = '1px solid rgba(255,255,255,0.38)';
11291                         viewer.element.style['-webkit-box-reflect'] =
11292                             'below 0px -webkit-gradient('+
11293                                 'linear,left '+
11294                                 'top,left '+
11295                                 'bottom,from(transparent),color-stop(62%,transparent),to(rgba(255,255,255,0.62))'+
11296                             ')';
11297                     }
11298 
11299                     drawer.addOverlay(
11300                         viewer.element,
11301                         tile.bounds
11302                     );
11303                 }
11304 
11305             }else{
11306                 viewer = drawer.collectionOverlays[ tileKey ];
11307                 if( viewer.viewport ){
11308                     viewer.viewport.resize( tile.size, true );
11309                     viewer.viewport.goHome( true );
11310                 }
11311             }
11312 
11313         } else {
11314 
11315             if ( USE_CANVAS ) {
11316                 // TODO do this in a more performant way
11317                 // specifically, don't save,rotate,restore every time we draw a tile
11318                 if( drawer.viewport.degrees !== 0 ) {
11319                     offsetForRotation( tile, drawer.canvas, drawer.context, drawer.viewport.degrees );
11320                     tile.drawCanvas( drawer.context );
11321                     restoreRotationChanges( tile, drawer.canvas, drawer.context );
11322                 } else {
11323                     tile.drawCanvas( drawer.context );
11324                 }
11325             } else {
11326                 tile.drawHTML( drawer.canvas );
11327             }
11328 
11329 
11330             tile.beingDrawn = true;
11331         }
11332 
11333         if( drawer.debugMode ){
11334             try{
11335                 drawDebugInfo( drawer, tile, lastDrawn.length, i );
11336             }catch(e){
11337                 $.console.error(e);
11338             }
11339         }
11340 
11341         if( drawer.viewer ){
11342             drawer.viewer.raiseEvent( 'tile-drawn', {
11343                 viewer: drawer.viewer,
11344                 tile: tile
11345             });
11346         }
11347     }
11348 }
11349 
11350 function offsetForRotation( tile, canvas, context, degrees ){
11351     var cx = canvas.width / 2,
11352         cy = canvas.height / 2,
11353         px = tile.position.x - cx,
11354         py = tile.position.y - cy;
11355 
11356     context.save();
11357 
11358     context.translate(cx, cy);
11359     context.rotate( Math.PI / 180 * degrees);
11360     tile.position.x = px;
11361     tile.position.y = py;
11362 }
11363 
11364 function restoreRotationChanges( tile, canvas, context ){
11365     var cx = canvas.width / 2,
11366         cy = canvas.height / 2,
11367         px = tile.position.x + cx,
11368         py = tile.position.y + cy;
11369 
11370     tile.position.x = px;
11371     tile.position.y = py;
11372 
11373     context.restore();
11374 }
11375 
11376 
11377 function drawDebugInfo( drawer, tile, count, i ){
11378 
11379     if ( USE_CANVAS ) {
11380         drawer.context.save();
11381         drawer.context.lineWidth = 2;
11382         drawer.context.font = 'small-caps bold 13px ariel';
11383         drawer.context.strokeStyle = drawer.debugGridColor;
11384         drawer.context.fillStyle = drawer.debugGridColor;
11385         drawer.context.strokeRect(
11386             tile.position.x,
11387             tile.position.y,
11388             tile.size.x,
11389             tile.size.y
11390         );
11391         if( tile.x === 0 && tile.y === 0 ){
11392             drawer.context.fillText(
11393                 "Zoom: " + drawer.viewport.getZoom(),
11394                 tile.position.x,
11395                 tile.position.y - 30
11396             );
11397             drawer.context.fillText(
11398                 "Pan: " + drawer.viewport.getBounds().toString(),
11399                 tile.position.x,
11400                 tile.position.y - 20
11401             );
11402         }
11403         drawer.context.fillText(
11404             "Level: " + tile.level,
11405             tile.position.x + 10,
11406             tile.position.y + 20
11407         );
11408         drawer.context.fillText(
11409             "Column: " + tile.x,
11410             tile.position.x + 10,
11411             tile.position.y + 30
11412         );
11413         drawer.context.fillText(
11414             "Row: " + tile.y,
11415             tile.position.x + 10,
11416             tile.position.y + 40
11417         );
11418         drawer.context.fillText(
11419             "Order: " + i + " of " + count,
11420             tile.position.x + 10,
11421             tile.position.y + 50
11422         );
11423         drawer.context.fillText(
11424             "Size: " + tile.size.toString(),
11425             tile.position.x + 10,
11426             tile.position.y + 60
11427         );
11428         drawer.context.fillText(
11429             "Position: " + tile.position.toString(),
11430             tile.position.x + 10,
11431             tile.position.y + 70
11432         );
11433         drawer.context.restore();
11434     }
11435 }
11436 
11437 
11438 }( OpenSeadragon ));
11439 
11440 /*
